sentences.zh: 晉唐叔虞者，周武王子而成王弟。

translations.literal: Jin Tang Shu Yu was King Wu of Zhou's son and King Cheng's younger brother.
translations.idiomatic: Jin Tang Shu Yu was King Wu of Zhou's son and King Cheng's younger brother.

sentences.zh: 初，武王與叔虞母會時，夢天謂武王曰：「余命女生子，名虞，余與之唐。」

translations.literal: Initially, Wu Wang with Shu Yu mother meet time, dreamed heaven told Wu Wang said: 'I command woman give birth son, name Yu, I give him Tang.'
translations.idiomatic: Initially, when King Wu met with Shu Yu's mother, he dreamed that heaven told King Wu: 'I command the woman to give birth to a son, name him Yu, and I will give him Tang.'

sentences.zh: 及生子，文在其手曰「虞」，故遂因命之曰虞。

translations.literal: And gave birth son, writing on his hand said 'Yu', therefore then followed named him Yu.
translations.idiomatic: And when she gave birth to a son, there was writing on his hand that said 'Yu'. Therefore they then followed this and named him Yu.

sentences.zh: 武王崩，成王立，唐有亂，周公誅滅唐。

translations.literal: King Wu died. King Cheng ascended. Tang had a rebellion. The Duke of Zhou executed and extinguished Tang.
translations.idiomatic: King Wu died. King Cheng ascended. Tang had a rebellion. The Duke of Zhou executed and extinguished Tang.

sentences.zh: 成王與叔虞戲，削桐葉為珪以與叔虞，曰：「以此封若。」

translations.literal: Cheng Wang with Shu Yu played, carved paulownia leaf as gui to give Shu Yu, said: 'With this enfeoff you.'
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng played with Shu Yu, carved a paulownia leaf as a gui to give to Shu Yu, and said: 'With this I enfeoff you.'

sentences.zh: 史佚因請擇日立叔虞。

translations.literal: Shi Yi then requested to select a day to establish Shu Yu.
translations.idiomatic: Shi Yi then requested to select a day to establish Shu Yu.

sentences.zh: 成王曰：「吾與之戲耳。」

translations.literal: Cheng Wang said: 'I with him played.'
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng said: 'I was only playing with him.'

sentences.zh: 史佚曰：「天子無戲言。

translations.literal: Shi Yi said: 'Tian zi no playing words.
translations.idiomatic: Shi Yi said: 'The Tian Zi has no playing words.

sentences.zh: 言則史書之，禮成之，樂歌之。」

translations.literal: Words then historians write them, rites complete them, music sings them.'
translations.idiomatic: If words are spoken, then historians write them, rites complete them, and music sings them.'

sentences.zh: 於是遂封叔虞於唐。

translations.literal: They then enfeoffed Shu Yu at Tang.
translations.idiomatic: They then enfeoffed Shu Yu at Tang.

sentences.zh: 唐在河、汾之東，方百里，故曰唐叔虞。

translations.literal: Tang was east of the He and Fen rivers, a square of a hundred li. Therefore he was called Tang Shu Yu.
translations.idiomatic: Tang was east of the He and Fen rivers, a square of a hundred li. Therefore he was called Tang Shu Yu.

sentences.zh: 姓姬氏，字子于。

translations.literal: His surname was the Ji clan. His courtesy name was Zi Yu.
translations.idiomatic: His surname was the Ji clan. His courtesy name was Zi Yu.

sentences.zh: 唐叔子燮，是為晉侯。

translations.literal: Tang Shu's son Xie became the Jin Hou.
translations.idiomatic: Tang Shu's son Xie became the Jin Hou.

sentences.zh: 晉侯子寧族，是為武侯。

translations.literal: Jin Hou's son Ning Zu became Wu Hou.
translations.idiomatic: Jin Hou's son Ning Zu became Wu Hou.

sentences.zh: 武侯之子服人，是為成侯。

translations.literal: Wu Hou's son Fu Ren became Cheng Hou.
translations.idiomatic: Wu Hou's son Fu Ren became Cheng Hou.

sentences.zh: 成侯子福，是為厲侯。

translations.literal: Cheng Hou's son Fu became Li Hou.
translations.idiomatic: Cheng Hou's son Fu became Li Hou.

sentences.zh: 厲侯之子宜臼，是為靖侯。

translations.literal: Li Hou's son Yi Jiu became Jing Hou.
translations.idiomatic: Li Hou's son Yi Jiu became Jing Hou.

sentences.zh: 靖侯已來，年紀可推。

translations.literal: Since Jing Hou, the years can be traced.
translations.idiomatic: Since Jing Hou, the years can be traced.

sentences.zh: 自唐叔至靖侯五世，無其年數。

translations.literal: From Tang Shu to Jing Hou were five generations, without their year numbers.
translations.idiomatic: From Tang Shu to Jing Hou were five generations, without their year numbers.

sentences.zh: 靖侯十七年，周厲王迷惑暴虐，國人作亂，厲王出奔于彘，大臣行政，故曰「共和」。

translations.literal: Jing Hou seventeenth year, Zhou Li Wang bewildered tyrannical cruel, state people made rebellion, Li Wang fled to Zhi, ministers administered government, therefore called 'Gong He'.
translations.idiomatic: In Jing Hou's seventeenth year, King Li of Zhou was bewildered, tyrannical, and cruel. The state people made rebellion, and King Li fled to Zhi. The ministers administered the government, therefore it was called 'Gong He'.

sentences.zh: 十八年，靖侯卒，子釐侯司徒立。

translations.literal: In the eighteenth year, Jing Hou died, and his son Xi Hou Si Tu ascended.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, Jing Hou died, and his son Xi Hou Si Tu succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 釐侯十四年，周宣王初立。

translations.literal: In Xi Hou's fourteenth year, King Xuan of Zhou initially ascended.
translations.idiomatic: In Xi Hou's fourteenth year, King Xuan of Zhou initially ascended.

sentences.zh: 十八年，釐侯卒，子獻侯籍立。

translations.literal: In the eighteenth year, Xi Hou died, and his son Xian Hou Ji ascended.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, Xi Hou died, and his son Xian Hou Ji succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 獻侯十一年卒，子穆侯費王立。

translations.literal: Xian Hou died in his eleventh year, and his son Mu Hou Fei Wang ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Xian Hou died in his eleventh year, and his son Mu Hou Fei Wang succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 穆侯四年，取齊女姜氏為夫人。

translations.literal: In Mu Hou's fourth year, he took a woman of the Jiang clan from Qi as his wife.
translations.idiomatic: In Mu Hou's fourth year, he took a woman of the Jiang clan from Qi as his wife.

sentences.zh: 七年，伐條。

translations.literal: In the seventh year, he attacked Tiao.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, he attacked Tiao.

sentences.zh: 生太子仇。

translations.literal: He gave birth to Crown Prince Qiu.
translations.idiomatic: He gave birth to Crown Prince Qiu.

sentences.zh: 十年，伐千畝，有功。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, he attacked Qian Mu and had merit.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, he attacked Qian Mu and had merit.

sentences.zh: 生少子，名曰成師。

translations.literal: He gave birth to a young son named Cheng Shi.
translations.idiomatic: He gave birth to a young son named Cheng Shi.

sentences.zh: 晉人師服曰：「異哉，君之命子也！

translations.literal: Jin person Shi Fu said: 'Strange, lord name son!'
translations.idiomatic: A Jin person named Shi Fu said: 'How strange, the lord's naming of his son!

sentences.zh: 太子曰仇，仇者讎也。

translations.literal: The crown prince is called Qiu. Qiu means enemy.
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince is called Qiu. Qiu means enemy.

sentences.zh: 少子曰成師，成師大號，成之者也。

translations.literal: The young son is called Cheng Shi. Cheng Shi is a great title—the one who will accomplish it.
translations.idiomatic: The young son is called Cheng Shi. Cheng Shi is a great title—the one who will accomplish it.

sentences.zh: 名自命也；

translations.literal: Names self fate;
translations.idiomatic: Names determine their own fate.

sentences.zh: 物自定也。

translations.literal: Things determine themselves.
translations.idiomatic: Things determine themselves.

sentences.zh: 今適庶名反逆，此後晉其能毋亂乎？」

translations.literal: Now legitimate concubine names contrary perverse, after this Jin can not chaos?'
translations.idiomatic: Now the legitimate and concubine names are contrary and perverse. After this, can Jin avoid chaos?'

sentences.zh: 二十七年，穆侯卒，弟殤叔自立，太子仇出奔。

translations.literal: In the twenty-seventh year, Mu Hou died. His younger brother Shang Shu self-established. Crown Prince Qiu fled.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-seventh year, Mu Hou died. His younger brother Shang Shu self-established. Crown Prince Qiu fled.

sentences.zh: 殤叔三年，周宣王崩。

translations.literal: In Shang Shu's third year, King Xuan of Zhou died.
translations.idiomatic: In Shang Shu's third year, King Xuan of Zhou died.

sentences.zh: 四年，穆侯太子仇率其徒襲殤叔而立，是為文侯。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, Mu Hou's crown prince Qiu led his followers, attacked Shang Shu, and established himself, becoming Wen Hou.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, Mu Hou's crown prince Qiu led his followers, attacked Shang Shu, and established himself, becoming Wen Hou.

sentences.zh: 文侯十年，周幽王無道，犬戎殺幽王，周東徙。

translations.literal: In Wen Hou's tenth year, King You of Zhou had no way. The Quan Rong killed King You. Zhou moved east.
translations.idiomatic: In Wen Hou's tenth year, King You of Zhou had no way. The Quan Rong killed King You. Zhou moved east.

sentences.zh: 而秦襄公始列為諸侯。

translations.literal: And Qin Xiang Gong began to be ranked as feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: And Qin Xiang Gong began to be ranked as feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 三十五年，文侯仇卒，子昭侯伯立。

translations.literal: In the thirty-fifth year, Wen Hou Qiu died, and his son Zhao Hou Bo ascended.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-fifth year, Wen Hou Qiu died, and his son Zhao Hou Bo succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 昭侯元年，封文侯弟成師于曲沃。

translations.literal: In Zhao Hou's first year, he enfeoffed Wen Hou's younger brother Cheng Shi at Qu Wo.
translations.idiomatic: In Zhao Hou's first year, he enfeoffed Wen Hou's younger brother Cheng Shi at Qu Wo.

sentences.zh: 曲沃邑大於翼。

translations.literal: The Qu Wo city was larger than Yi.
translations.idiomatic: The Qu Wo city was larger than Yi.

sentences.zh: 翼，晉君都邑也。

translations.literal: Yi was the Jin lord's capital city.
translations.idiomatic: Yi was the Jin lord's capital city.

sentences.zh: 成師封曲沃，號為桓叔。

translations.literal: Cheng Shi was enfeoffed at Qu Wo and styled Huan Shu.
translations.idiomatic: Cheng Shi was enfeoffed at Qu Wo and styled Huan Shu.

sentences.zh: 靖侯庶孫欒賓相桓叔。

translations.literal: Jing Hou's concubine grandson Luan Bin assisted Huan Shu.
translations.idiomatic: Jing Hou's concubine grandson Luan Bin assisted Huan Shu.

sentences.zh: 桓叔是時年五十八矣，好德，晉國之眾皆附焉。

translations.literal: Huan Shu at this time was fifty-eight years old, good at virtue. All the crowds of Jin state attached themselves to him.
translations.idiomatic: Huan Shu at this time was fifty-eight years old and good at virtue. All the crowds of the Jin state attached themselves to him.

sentences.zh: 君子曰：「晉之亂其在曲沃矣。

translations.literal: Gentleman said: 'Jin chaos perhaps at Qu Wo.'
translations.idiomatic: A gentleman said: 'Jin's chaos is perhaps at Qu Wo.

sentences.zh: 末大於本而得民心，不亂何待！」

translations.literal: Branch larger than root and obtains people heart, not chaos what wait!'
translations.idiomatic: When the branch is larger than the root and obtains the people's heart, what can one wait for but chaos!'

sentences.zh: 七年，晉大臣潘父弒其君昭侯而迎曲沃桓叔。

translations.literal: In the seventh year, Jin's minister Pan Fu assassinated his lord Zhao Hou and welcomed Qu Wo's Huan Shu.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, Jin's minister Pan Fu assassinated his lord Zhao Hou and welcomed Qu Wo's Huan Shu.

sentences.zh: 桓叔欲入晉，晉人發兵攻桓叔。

translations.literal: Huan Shu desired to enter Jin. The Jin people sent troops to attack Huan Shu.
translations.idiomatic: Huan Shu desired to enter Jin. The Jin people sent troops to attack Huan Shu.

sentences.zh: 桓叔敗，還歸曲沃。

translations.literal: Huan Shu was defeated and returned to Qu Wo.
translations.idiomatic: Huan Shu was defeated and returned to Qu Wo.

sentences.zh: 晉人共立昭侯子平為君，是為孝侯。

translations.literal: The Jin people together established Zhao Hou's son Ping as lord, who became Xiao Hou.
translations.idiomatic: The Jin people together established Zhao Hou's son Ping as lord, who became Xiao Hou.

sentences.zh: 誅潘父。

translations.literal: They executed Pan Fu.
translations.idiomatic: They executed Pan Fu.

sentences.zh: 孝侯八年，曲沃桓叔卒，子胛桓叔，是為曲沃莊伯。

translations.literal: In Xiao Hou's eighth year, Qu Wo's Huan Shu died. His son Jia became Huan Shu, who was Qu Wo Zhuang Bo.
translations.idiomatic: In Xiao Hou's eighth year, Qu Wo's Huan Shu died. His son Jia succeeded the Huan Shu and became Qu Wo Zhuang Bo.

sentences.zh: 孝侯十五年，曲沃莊伯弒其君晉孝侯于翼。

translations.literal: In Xiao Hou's fifteenth year, Qu Wo Zhuang Bo assassinated his lord Jin Xiao Hou at Yi.
translations.idiomatic: In Xiao Hou's fifteenth year, Qu Wo Zhuang Bo assassinated his lord the Jin Xiao Hou at Yi.

sentences.zh: 晉人攻曲沃莊伯，莊伯復入曲沃。

translations.literal: The Jin people attacked Qu Wo Zhuang Bo. Zhuang Bo again entered Qu Wo.
translations.idiomatic: The Jin people attacked Qu Wo Zhuang Bo. Zhuang Bo again entered Qu Wo.

sentences.zh: 晉人復立孝侯子郄為君，是為鄂侯。

translations.literal: The Jin people again established Xiao Hou's son Xi as lord, who became E Hou.
translations.idiomatic: The Jin people again established Xiao Hou's son Xi as lord, who became E Hou.

sentences.zh: 鄂侯六年卒。

translations.literal: E Hou died in his sixth year.
translations.idiomatic: E Hou died in his sixth year.

sentences.zh: 曲沃莊伯聞晉鄂侯卒，乃興兵伐晉。

translations.literal: Qu Wo Zhuang Bo heard that Jin E Hou died, then raised troops to attack Jin.
translations.idiomatic: Qu Wo Zhuang Bo heard that the Jin E Hou died, then raised troops to attack Jin.

sentences.zh: 周平王使虢公將兵伐曲沃莊伯，莊伯走保曲沃。

translations.literal: Zhou Ping Wang made Guo Gong lead troops to attack Qu Wo Zhuang Bo. Zhuang Bo fled to defend Qu Wo.
translations.idiomatic: King Ping of Zhou made Guo Gong lead troops to attack Qu Wo Zhuang Bo. The Zhuang Bo fled to defend Qu Wo.

sentences.zh: 晉人共立鄂侯子光，是為哀侯。

translations.literal: The Jin people together established E Hou's son Guang, who became Ai Hou.
translations.idiomatic: The Jin people together established E Hou's son Guang, who became Ai Hou.

sentences.zh: 哀侯二年曲沃莊伯卒，子稱代莊伯立，是為曲沃武公。

translations.literal: In Ai Hou's second year, Qu Wo Zhuang Bo died. His son Cheng replaced Zhuang Bo and ascended, becoming Qu Wo Wu Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In Ai Hou's second year, Qu Wo Zhuang Bo died. His son Cheng replaced the Zhuang Bo and ascended, becoming Qu Wo Wu Gong.

sentences.zh: 哀侯六年，魯弒其君隱公。

translations.literal: In Ai Hou's sixth year, Lu assassinated their lord Duke Yin.
translations.idiomatic: In Ai Hou's sixth year, Lu assassinated their lord Duke Yin.

sentences.zh: 哀侯八年，晉侵陘廷。

translations.literal: In Ai Hou's eighth year, Jin invaded Xing Ting.
translations.idiomatic: In Ai Hou's eighth year, Jin invaded Xing Ting.

sentences.zh: 陘廷與曲沃武公謀，九年，伐晉于汾旁，虜哀侯。

translations.literal: Xing Ting plotted with Qu Wo Wu Gong. In the ninth year, they attacked Jin by the Fen River and captured Ai Hou.
translations.idiomatic: Xing Ting plotted with Qu Wo Wu Gong. In the ninth year, they attacked Jin by the Fen River and captured Ai Hou.

sentences.zh: 晉人乃立哀侯子小子為君，是為小子侯。

translations.literal: The Jin people then established Ai Hou's son Xiao Zi as lord, who became Xiao Zi Hou.
translations.idiomatic: The Jin people then established Ai Hou's son Xiao Zi as lord, who became Xiao Zi Hou.

sentences.zh: 小子元年，曲沃武公使韓萬殺所虜晉哀侯。

translations.literal: In Xiao Zi's first year, Qu Wo Wu Gong made Han Wan kill the captured Jin Ai Hou.
translations.idiomatic: In Xiao Zi's first year, Qu Wo Wu Gong made Han Wan kill the captured Jin Ai Hou.

sentences.zh: 曲沃益彊，晉無如之何。

translations.literal: Qu Wo became increasingly strong. Jin had no way to deal with it.
translations.idiomatic: Qu Wo became increasingly strong. Jin had no way to deal with it.

sentences.zh: 晉小子之四年，曲沃武公誘召晉小子殺之。

translations.literal: In Jin Xiao Zi's fourth year, Qu Wo Wu Gong lured and summoned Jin Xiao Zi and killed him.
translations.idiomatic: In Jin Xiao Zi's fourth year, Qu Wo Wu Gong lured and summoned the Jin Xiao Zi and killed him.

sentences.zh: 周桓王使虢仲伐曲沃武公，武公入于曲沃，乃立晉哀侯弟緡為晉侯。

translations.literal: Zhou Huan Wang made Guo Zhong attack Qu Wo Wu Gong. Wu Gong entered Qu Wo. They then established Jin Ai Hou's younger brother Min as Jin Hou.
translations.idiomatic: King Huan of Zhou made Guo Zhong attack Qu Wo Wu Gong. Wu Gong entered Qu Wo. They then established Jin Ai Hou's younger brother Min as the Jin Hou.

sentences.zh: 晉侯緡四年，宋執鄭祭仲而立突為鄭君。

translations.literal: In Jin Hou Min's fourth year, Song seized Zheng's Ji Zhong and established Tu as Zheng's lord.
translations.idiomatic: In Jin Hou Min's fourth year, Song seized Zheng's Ji Zhong and established Tu as the Zheng's lord.

sentences.zh: 晉侯十九年，齊人管至父弒其君襄公。

translations.literal: In Jin Hou's nineteenth year, Qi's Guan Zhi Fu assassinated their lord Duke Xiang.
translations.idiomatic: In Jin Hou's nineteenth year, Qi's Guan Zhi Fu assassinated their lord the Duke Xiang.

sentences.zh: 晉侯二十八年，齊桓公始霸。

translations.literal: In Jin Hou's twenty-eighth year, Qi's Duke Huan began his hegemony.
translations.idiomatic: In Jin Hou's twenty-eighth year, Qi's Duke Huan began his hegemony.

sentences.zh: 曲沃武公伐晉侯緡，滅之，盡以其寶器賂獻于周釐王。

translations.literal: Qu Wo Wu Gong attacked Jin Hou Min and extinguished him. He completely bribed and presented his precious vessels to Zhou Xi Wang.
translations.idiomatic: Qu Wo Wu Gong attacked Jin Hou Min and extinguished him. He completely bribed and presented his precious vessels to the King Xi of Zhou.

sentences.zh: 釐王命曲沃武公為晉君，列為諸侯，於是盡併晉地而有之。

translations.literal: Xi Wang commanded Qu Wo Wu Gong to be Jin's lord, ranked as feudal lords. Then he completely annexed Jin's territory and possessed it.
translations.idiomatic: King Xi commanded Qu Wo Wu Gong to be the Jin's lord, ranked as feudal lords. Then he completely annexed Jin's territory and possessed it.

sentences.zh: 曲沃武公已即位三十七年矣，更號曰晉武公。

translations.literal: Qu Wo Wu Gong had already ascended for thirty-seven years. He changed his title to Jin Wu Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Qu Wo Wu Gong had already ascended for thirty-seven years. He changed his title to the Jin Wu Gong.

sentences.zh: 晉武公始都晉國，前即位曲沃，通年三十八年。

translations.literal: Jin Wu Gong began to make his capital in the Jin state. Before ascending, he was at Qu Wo. Total years were thirty-eight.
translations.idiomatic: Jin Wu Gong began to make his capital in the Jin state. Before ascending, he was at Qu Wo. Total years were thirty-eight.

sentences.zh: 武公稱者，先晉穆侯曾孫也，曲沃桓叔孫也。

translations.literal: The one called Wu Gong was the former Jin Mu Hou's great-grandson, and Qu Wo Huan Shu's grandson.
translations.idiomatic: The one called Wu Gong was the former Jin Mu Hou's great-grandson, and Qu Wo Huan Shu's grandson.

sentences.zh: 桓叔者，始封曲沃。

translations.literal: Huan Shu was the one who began to be enfeoffed at Qu Wo.
translations.idiomatic: Huan Shu was the one who began to be enfeoffed at Qu Wo.

sentences.zh: 武公，莊伯子也。

translations.literal: Wu Gong was Zhuang Bo's son.
translations.idiomatic: Wu Gong was Zhuang Bo's son.

sentences.zh: 自桓叔初封曲沃以至武公滅晉也，凡六十七歲，而卒代晉為諸侯。

translations.literal: From Huan Shu's initial enfeoffment at Qu Wo until Wu Gong extinguished Jin, altogether sixty-seven years, and he finally replaced Jin as feudal lord.
translations.idiomatic: From Huan Shu's initial enfeoffment at Qu Wo until Wu Gong extinguished Jin, altogether sixty-seven years, and he finally replaced Jin as the feudal lord.

sentences.zh: 武公代晉二歲，卒。

translations.literal: Wu Gong replaced Jin for two years, then died.
translations.idiomatic: Wu Gong replaced Jin for two years, then died.

sentences.zh: 與曲沃通年，即位凡三十九年而卒。

translations.literal: With Qu Wo total years, he ascended for altogether thirty-nine years and died.
translations.idiomatic: With the Qu Wo total years, he ascended for altogether thirty-nine years and died.

sentences.zh: 子獻公詭諸立。

translations.literal: His son Duke Xian Gui Zhu ascended.
translations.idiomatic: His son Duke Xian Gui Zhu succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 獻公元年，周惠王弟穨攻惠王，惠王出奔，居鄭之櫟邑。

translations.literal: In Duke Xian's first year, Zhou Hui Wang's younger brother Sui attacked Hui Wang. Hui Wang fled and resided in Zheng's Li Yi.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xian's first year, King Hui of Zhou's younger brother Sui attacked King Hui. King Hui fled and resided in the Zheng's Li Yi.

sentences.zh: 五年，伐驪戎，得驪姬、驪姬弟，俱愛幸之。

translations.literal: In the fifth year, he attacked the Li Rong and obtained Li Ji and Li Ji's younger brother. He loved and favored them both.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, he attacked the Li Rong and obtained Li Ji and Li Ji's younger brother. He loved and favored them both.

sentences.zh: 八年，士蒍說公曰：「故晉之群公子多，不誅，亂且起。」

translations.literal: Eighth year, Shi Wei persuaded gong said: 'Former Jin group princes many, not execute, chaos about to rise.'
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, Shi Wei persuaded the gong and said: 'The former Jin's group of princes are many. If they are not executed, chaos is about to rise.'

sentences.zh: 乃使盡殺諸公子，而城聚都之，命曰絳，始都絳。

translations.literal: He then made them completely kill the various princes, walled and gathered them as capital, named it Jiang, and began to make Jiang the capital.
translations.idiomatic: He then made them completely kill the various princes, walled and gathered them as capital, named it Jiang, and began to make Jiang the capital.

sentences.zh: 九年，晉群公子既亡奔虢，虢以其故再伐晉，弗克。

translations.literal: In the ninth year, Jin's group of princes had already fled to Guo. Guo because of this reason again attacked Jin but did not conquer.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, Jin's group of princes had already fled to Guo. Guo, because of this reason, again attacked Jin but did not conquer.

sentences.zh: 十年，晉欲伐虢，士蒍曰：「且待其亂。」

translations.literal: Tenth year, Jin desired attack Guo, Shi Wei said: 'Moreover wait their chaos.'
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, Jin desired to attack Guo. Shi Wei said: 'Moreover, wait for their chaos.'

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, Li Ji gave birth to Xi Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, Li Ji gave birth to Xi Qi.

sentences.zh: 獻公有意廢太子，乃曰：「曲沃吾先祖宗廟所在，而蒲邊秦，屈邊翟，不使諸子居之，我懼焉。」

translations.literal: Xian Gong had intention to depose crown prince, then said: 'Qu Wo my first ancestor ancestral temple located, and Pu borders Qin, Qu borders Di, not make various sons reside there, I fear it.'

sentences.zh: 於是使太子申生居曲沃，公子重耳居蒲，公子夷吾居屈。

translations.literal: He then made Crown Prince Shen Sheng reside at Qu Wo, Prince Chong Er reside at Pu, and Prince Yi Wu reside at Qu.
translations.idiomatic: He then made Crown Prince Shen Sheng reside at Qu Wo, Prince Chong Er reside at Pu, and Prince Yi Wu reside at the Qu.

translations.idiomatic: Duke Xian resided at Jiang with Li Ji's son Xi Qi.

sentences.zh: 晉國以此知太子不立也。

translations.literal: Jin's state with this knew the crown prince would not be established.
translations.idiomatic: Jin's state with this knew the crown prince would not be established.

sentences.zh: 太子申生，其母齊桓公女也，曰齊姜，早死。

translations.literal: Crown Prince Shen Sheng—his mother was Qi Huan Gong's daughter, called Qi Jiang. She died early.
translations.idiomatic: Crown Prince Shen Sheng—his mother was the Duke Huan of Qi's daughter, called Qi Jiang. She died early.

sentences.zh: 申生同母女弟為秦穆公夫人。

translations.literal: Shen Sheng's same mother younger sister became Qin Mu Gong's wife.
translations.idiomatic: Shen Sheng's same mother younger sister became Duke Mu of Qin's wife.

sentences.zh: 重耳母，翟之狐氏女也。

translations.literal: Chong Er's mother was a woman of the Hu clan from the Di.
translations.idiomatic: Chong Er's mother was a woman of the Hu clan from the Di.

sentences.zh: 夷吾母，重耳母女弟也。

translations.literal: Yi Wu's mother was Chong Er's mother's younger sister.
translations.idiomatic: Yi Wu's mother was Chong Er's mother's younger sister.

sentences.zh: 獻公子八人，而太子申生、重耳、夷吾皆有賢行。

translations.literal: Duke Xian had eight princes, and Crown Prince Shen Sheng, Chong Er, and Yi Wu all had worthy conduct.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xian had eight princes, and Crown Prince Shen Sheng, Chong Er, and Yi Wu all had the worthy conduct.

sentences.zh: 及得驪姬，乃遠此三子。

translations.literal: When he obtained Li Ji, he then distanced these three sons.
translations.idiomatic: When he obtained Li Ji, he then distanced these three sons.

sentences.zh: 十六年，晉獻公作二軍。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, Jin's Duke Xian made two armies.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, Jin's Duke Xian made two armies.

sentences.zh: 公將上軍，太子申生將下軍，趙夙御戎，畢萬為右，伐滅霍，滅魏，滅耿。

translations.literal: The gong led the upper army. Crown Prince Shen Sheng led the lower army. Zhao Su drove the chariot. Bi Wan was on the right. They attacked and extinguished Huo, extinguished Wei, extinguished Geng.
translations.idiomatic: The gong led the upper army. Crown Prince Shen Sheng led the lower army. Zhao Su drove the chariot. Bi Wan was on the right. They attacked and extinguished Huo, extinguished Wei, and extinguished Geng.

sentences.zh: 還，為太子城曲沃，賜趙夙耿，賜畢萬魏，以為大夫。

translations.literal: Upon returning, for the crown prince he walled Qu Wo. He granted Zhao Su Geng, granted Bi Wan Wei, to be grand officers.
translations.idiomatic: Upon returning, for the crown prince he walled Qu Wo. He granted Zhao Su Geng and granted Bi Wan Wei, to be grand officers.

sentences.zh: 士蒍曰：「太子不得立矣。

translations.literal: Shi Wei said: 'Crown prince not able established.'
translations.idiomatic: Shi Wei said: 'The crown prince will not be able to be established.

sentences.zh: 分之都城，而位以卿，先為之極，又安得立！

translations.literal: Divided him capital city, and positioned with qing, first made him pole, again how obtain establish!'
translations.idiomatic: He has been divided from the capital city, and positioned with qing, first made the pole, again how can he obtain establishment!'

sentences.zh: 不如逃之，無使罪至。

translations.literal: It would be better to flee it. Do not let crime arrive.
translations.idiomatic: It would be better to flee. Do not let crime arrive.

sentences.zh: 為吳太伯，不亦可乎，猶有令名。」

translations.idiomatic: To be like Wu Tai Bo, is this not also permissible? You will still have a good name.'

translations.literal: The crown prince did not follow.
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince did not follow.

translations.idiomatic: Bu Yan said: 'Bi Wan's descendants must be great.

translations.literal: Wan, full number;
translations.idiomatic: Wan is a full number;

translations.literal: Wei is a great name.
translations.idiomatic: Wei is a great name.

translations.literal: Beginning the reward with this—heaven opened it.
translations.idiomatic: Beginning the reward with this—heaven opened it.

translations.literal: Tian zi called myriad people, feudal lords called ten thousand people, now name it great, to follow full number, it must have multitude.'
translations.idiomatic: The Tian Zi is called myriad people, feudal lords are called ten thousand people. Now naming it great, to follow the full number, it must have a multitude.'

translations.idiomatic: Xin Liao divined it and said: 'Auspicious.

translations.idiomatic: Its descendants must flourish and prosper.'

translations.literal: In the seventeenth year, the Jin Hou made Crown Prince Shen Sheng attack Dong Shan.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventeenth year, the Jin Hou made Crown Prince Shen Sheng attack Dong Shan.

translations.literal: Li Ke admonished Xian Gong said: 'Crown prince offers ancestral sacrifices state altars millet offerings, with morning evening oversees lord meals, therefore called eldest son.

sentences.zh: 君行則守，有守則從，從曰撫軍，守曰監國，古之制也。

translations.literal: When the lord goes, then there is a guard. Having a guard, then there is following. Following is called soothing the army. Guarding is called overseeing the state. This is the ancient system.
translations.idiomatic: When the lord goes, then there is a guard. Having a guard, then there is following. Following is called soothing the army. Guarding is called overseeing the state. This is the ancient system.

translations.literal: Leading troops, monopolizing action planning;
translations.idiomatic: Leading troops is monopolizing action and planning;

translations.literal: Oathing armies, lord and state governance what plotted: not crown prince matter.
translations.idiomatic: Oathing armies is what the lord and state governance plot: this is not the crown prince's matter.

sentences.zh: 師在制命而已，稟命則不威，專命則不孝，故君之嗣適不可以帥師。

translations.literal: The troops are in controlling commands only. Receiving commands then not awe-inspiring. Monopolizing commands then not filial. Therefore the lord's proper heir cannot lead troops.
translations.idiomatic: The troops are in controlling commands only. Receiving commands then is not awe-inspiring. Monopolizing commands then is not filial. Therefore, the lord's proper heir cannot lead troops.

translations.literal: Lord loses his office, leads troops not awe-inspiring, how use it?'
translations.idiomatic: If the lord loses his office and leads troops without being awe-inspiring, how will you use it?'

sentences.zh: 公曰：「寡人有子，未知其太子誰立。」

translations.literal: Gong said: 'I have sons, not know their crown prince who establish.'
translations.idiomatic: The gong said: 'I have sons, but I do not know which one will be established as crown prince.'

sentences.zh: 裏克不對而退，見太子。

translations.literal: Li Ke did not reply and retreated. He saw the crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: Li Ke did not reply and retreated. He saw the crown prince.

sentences.zh: 太子曰：「吾其廢乎？」

translations.literal: Crown prince said: 'I perhaps deposed?'
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince said: 'Am I perhaps to be deposed?'

sentences.zh: 裏克曰：「太子勉之！

translations.literal: Li Ke said: 'Crown prince strive!'
translations.idiomatic: Li Ke said: 'Crown prince, strive!'

sentences.zh: 教以軍旅，不共是懼，何故廢乎？

translations.literal: Taught with armies, not share this fear, why deposed?
translations.idiomatic: You have been taught with armies, and you do not share this fear. Why would you be deposed?

sentences.zh: 且子懼不孝，毋懼不得立。

translations.literal: Moreover, fear not being filial. Do not fear not being established.
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, fear not being filial. Do not fear not being established.

sentences.zh: 修己而不責人，則免於難。」

translations.literal: Cultivate self and not blame others, then avoid calamity.'
translations.idiomatic: Cultivate yourself and do not blame others, then you will avoid calamity.'

sentences.zh: 太子帥師，公衣之偏衣，佩之金玦。

translations.literal: The crown prince led troops. The gong clothed him in a one-sided robe and belted him with a gold jue.
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince led the troops. The gong clothed him in a one-sided robe and belted him with a gold jue.

sentences.zh: 裏克謝病，不從太子。

translations.literal: Li Ke declined with illness. He did not follow the crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: Li Ke declined with illness. He did not follow the crown prince.

sentences.zh: 太子遂伐東山。

translations.literal: The crown prince then attacked Dong Shan.
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince then attacked Dong Shan.

sentences.zh: 十九年，獻公曰：「始吾先君莊伯、武公之誅晉亂，而虢常助晉伐我，又匿晉亡公子，果為亂。

translations.literal: Nineteenth year, Xian Gong said: 'Beginning my first lords Zhuang Bo, Wu Gong executed Jin chaos, and Guo often helped Jin attacked me, again hid Jin fled princes, indeed made rebellion.

translations.literal: Not execute, later leave descendants worry.'
translations.idiomatic: If they are not executed, they will later leave descendants worry.'

translations.literal: He then made Xun Xi with Qu Chan's horses request passage through Yu.
translations.idiomatic: He then made Xun Xi with Qu Chan's horses request passage through Yu.

translations.literal: Yu granted passage. He then attacked Guo, took its Xia Yang and returned.
translations.idiomatic: Yu granted passage. He then attacked Guo, took its Xia Yang, and returned.

translations.literal: Xian Gong privately told Li Ji said: 'I desire depose crown prince, with Xi Qi replace him.'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xian privately told Li Ji and said: 'I desire to depose the crown prince and replace him with Xi Qi.'

sentences.zh: 驪姬泣曰：「太子之立，諸侯皆已知之，而數將兵，百姓附之，柰何以賤妾之故廢適立庶？

translations.literal: Li Ji wept said: 'Crown prince establishment, feudal lords all already know it, and frequently led troops, common people attached to him, how with lowly concubine reason depose proper establish concubine?
translations.idiomatic: Li Ji wept and said: 'The crown prince's establishment, all feudal lords already know it, and he frequently led troops, and common people attached to him. How can you, with a lowly concubine's reason, depose the proper and establish a concubine?

sentences.zh: 君必行之，妾自殺也。」

translations.literal: Lord must do it, concubine suicide.'
translations.idiomatic: If the lord must do it, this concubine will commit suicide.'

translations.literal: Li Ji pretended to praise the crown prince, but secretly made people slander and harm the crown prince, desiring to establish her own son.
translations.idiomatic: Li Ji pretended to praise the crown prince, but secretly made people slander and harm the crown prince, desiring to establish her own son.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，驪姬謂太子曰：「君夢見齊姜，太子速祭曲沃，歸釐於君。」

translations.literal: Twenty-first year, Li Ji told crown prince said: 'Lord dreamed saw Qi Jiang, crown prince quickly sacrifice Qu Wo, return blessing to lord.'
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-first year, Li Ji told the crown prince and said: 'The lord dreamed and saw Qi Jiang. Crown prince, quickly sacrifice at Qu Wo and return the blessing to the lord.'

sentences.zh: 太子於是祭其母齊姜於曲沃，上其薦胙於獻公。

translations.literal: The crown prince then sacrificed to his mother Qi Jiang at Qu Wo and presented the sacrificial meat to Duke Xian.
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince then sacrificed to his mother Qi Jiang at Qu Wo and presented the sacrificial meat to Duke Xian.

translations.literal: Duke Xian at the time went hunting and placed the meat in the palace.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xian at the time went hunting and placed the meat in the palace.

translations.idiomatic: Li Ji made people place poison in the meat.

translations.idiomatic: After staying two days, Duke Xian came back from hunting. The cook presented the meat to Duke Xian. Duke Xian desired to taste it.

sentences.zh: 驪姬從旁止之，曰：「胙所從來遠，宜試之。」

translations.literal: Li Ji from side stopped him, said: 'Meat where from come far, should test it.'
translations.idiomatic: Li Ji from the side stopped him and said: 'The meat has come from far away. You should test it.'

sentences.zh: 祭地，地墳；

translations.literal: Sacrificed earth, earth rose;
translations.idiomatic: When they sacrificed to the earth, the earth rose;

sentences.zh: 與犬，犬死；

translations.literal: Gave to dog, dog died;
translations.idiomatic: When they gave it to a dog, the dog died;

translations.literal: He gave it to a small minister, and the small minister died.
translations.idiomatic: He gave it to a small minister, and the small minister died.

translations.idiomatic: Li Ji wept and said: 'How cruel is the crown prince!

sentences.zh: 且君老矣，旦暮之人，曾不能待而欲弒之！」

translations.literal: Moreover lord old, morning evening person, once cannot wait and desires assassinate him!'
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, the lord is old, a person of morning and evening. Once he cannot wait, and he desires to assassinate him!'

translations.literal: Told Xian Gong said: 'Crown prince so do, not more than because concubine and Xi Qi reason.
translations.idiomatic: She told Duke Xian and said: 'The crown prince does this for no more than because of this concubine and Xi Qi's reason.

translations.literal: I wish mother and son would avoid to another state. If we suicide early, we won't vainly let mother and son be butchered by the crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: I wish mother and son would avoid to another state. If we commit suicide early, we won't vainly let mother and son be butchered by the crown prince.

translations.idiomatic: The crown prince heard of it and fled to Xin Cheng.

translations.idiomatic: Duke Xian was angered and then executed his tutor Du Yuan Kuan.

sentences.zh: 或謂太子曰：「為此藥者乃驪姬也，太子何不自辭明之？」

translations.literal: Someone told crown prince said: 'Made this medicine was Li Ji, crown prince why not self explain clarify it?'
translations.idiomatic: Someone told the crown prince and said: 'The one who made this medicine was Li Ji. Crown prince, why do you not explain and clarify it yourself?'

translations.idiomatic: The crown prince said: 'My lord is old. Without Li Ji, he sleeps not peacefully and eats not sweetly.

translations.idiomatic: If I explain it, the lord will be angry about it.

translations.idiomatic: It is not permissible.'

translations.idiomatic: Someone told the crown prince and said: 'You can flee to another state.'

translations.idiomatic: The crown prince said: 'If I carry this evil name and leave, which people will accept me?

translations.literal: I suicide.'
translations.idiomatic: I will commit suicide.'

translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth month, on Wu Shen, Shen Sheng committed suicide at Xin Cheng.

translations.idiomatic: At this time, Chong Er and Yi Wu came to court.

translations.idiomatic: Someone told Li Ji and said: 'The two princes resent Li Ji for slandering and killing the crown prince.'

translations.idiomatic: Initially, Duke Xian made Shi Wei build cities for the two princes at Pu and Qu, but he did not complete them.

translations.literal: Chong Er then fled to Di.
translations.idiomatic: Chong Er then fled to Di.

sentences.zh: 使人伐屈，屈城守，不可下。

translations.literal: He made people attack Qu. The Qu city defended, and it could not be conquered.
translations.idiomatic: He sent people to attack Qu. The Qu city defended, and it could not be conquered.

sentences.zh: 是歲也，晉復假道於虞以伐虢。

translations.literal: This year, Jin again requested passage through Yu to attack Guo.
translations.idiomatic: This year, Jin again requested passage through Yu to attack Guo.

sentences.zh: 虞之大夫宮之奇諫虞君曰：「晉不可假道也，是且滅虞。」

translations.literal: Yu grand officer Gong Zhi Qi admonished Yu lord said: 'Jin not can grant road, this about extinguish Yu.'
translations.idiomatic: Yu's grand officer Gong Zhi Qi admonished the Yu lord and said: 'Jin cannot be granted passage. This is about to extinguish Yu.'

sentences.zh: 虞君曰：「晉我同姓，不宜伐我。」

translations.literal: Yu lord said: 'Jin I same surname, not proper attack me.'
translations.idiomatic: The Yu lord said: 'Jin and I share the same surname. It is not proper to attack me.'

sentences.zh: 宮之奇曰：「太伯、虞仲，太王之子也，太伯亡去，是以不嗣。

translations.literal: Gong Zhi Qi said: 'Tai Bo, Yu Zhong, Tai Wang sons, Tai Bo fled away, therefore not succeeded.
translations.idiomatic: Gong Zhi Qi said: 'Tai Bo and Yu Zhong were the Tai Wang's sons. Tai Bo fled away, therefore he did not succeed.

sentences.zh: 虢仲、虢叔，王季之子也，為文王卿士，其記勳在王室，藏於盟府。

translations.literal: Guo Zhong and Guo Shu were Wang Ji's sons. They served as Wen Wang's qing shi. Their recorded merits are in the wang chamber, stored in the alliance treasury.
translations.idiomatic: Guo Zhong and Guo Shu were Wang Ji's sons. They served as King Wen's qing shi. Their recorded merits are in the royal chamber, stored in the alliance treasury.

sentences.zh: 將虢是滅，何愛于虞？

translations.literal: Will Guo be extinguished, why cherish Yu?
translations.idiomatic: If Guo will be extinguished, why cherish Yu?

sentences.zh: 且虞之親能親於桓、莊之族乎？

translations.literal: Moreover Yu kinship can closer than Huan, Zhuang clans?
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, can Yu's kinship be closer than the Huan and Zhuang clans?

sentences.zh: 桓、莊之族何罪，盡滅之。

translations.literal: What crime did the Huan and Zhuang clans commit? They completely extinguished them.
translations.idiomatic: What crime did the Huan and Zhuang clans commit? They completely extinguished them.

sentences.zh: 虞之與虢，脣之與齒，脣亡則齒寒。」

translations.literal: Yu and Guo, lips and teeth, lips gone then teeth cold.'
translations.idiomatic: Yu and Guo are like lips and teeth. If the lips are gone, then the teeth will be cold.'

sentences.zh: 虞公不聽，遂許晉。

translations.literal: The Yu gong did not listen, and then permitted Jin.
translations.idiomatic: The Yu gong did not listen, and then permitted Jin.

sentences.zh: 宮之奇以其族去虞。

translations.literal: Gong Zhi Qi left Yu with his clan.
translations.idiomatic: Gong Zhi Qi left Yu with his clan.

sentences.zh: 其冬，晉滅虢，虢公丑奔周。

translations.literal: That winter, Jin extinguished Guo. Duke Chou of Guo fled to Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: That winter, Jin extinguished Guo. Duke Chou of Guo fled to Zhou.

sentences.zh: 還，襲滅虞，虜虞公及其大夫井伯百里奚以媵秦穆姬，而修虞祀。

translations.literal: They returned and raided to extinguish Yu, capturing the Yu gong and his grand officer Jing Bo Bai Li Xi to accompany Qin Mu Ji, while maintaining Yu's sacrifices.
translations.idiomatic: They returned and raided to extinguish Yu, capturing the Yu gong and his grand officer Jing Bo Bai Li Xi to accompany Qin Mu Ji, while maintaining Yu's sacrifices.

sentences.zh: 荀息牽曩所遺虞屈產之乘馬奉之獻公，獻公笑曰：「馬則吾馬，齒亦老矣！」

translations.literal: Xun Xi led previously left Yu Qu produced horses presented to Xian Gong, Xian Gong laughed said: 'Horses then my horses, teeth also old!'
translations.idiomatic: Xun Xi led the previously left Yu Qu produced horses and presented them to Duke Xian. Duke Xian laughed and said: 'The horses are then my horses, but their teeth are also old!'

sentences.zh: 二十三年，獻公遂發賈華等伐屈，屈潰。

translations.literal: In the twenty-third year, Duke Xian then sent Jia Hua and others to attack Qu. Qu collapsed.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-third year, Duke Xian then sent Jia Hua and others to attack Qu. Qu collapsed.

sentences.zh: 夷吾將奔翟。

translations.literal: Yi Wu was about to flee to Di.
translations.idiomatic: Yi Wu was about to flee to Di.

sentences.zh: 冀芮曰：「不可，重耳已在矣，今往，晉必移兵伐翟，翟畏晉，禍且及。

translations.literal: Ji Rui said: 'Not permissible, Chong Er already there, now go, Jin must shift troops attack Di, Di fears Jin, calamity about reach.
translations.idiomatic: Ji Rui said: 'It is not permissible. Chong Er is already there. If we go now, Jin must shift troops to attack Di. Di fears Jin, and the calamity is about to reach us.

sentences.zh: 不如走梁，梁近於秦，秦彊，吾君百歲後可以求入焉。」

translations.literal: Not as good flee Liang, Liang near Qin, Qin strong, our lord hundred years after can seek enter.'
translations.idiomatic: It would be better to flee to Liang. Liang is near Qin, and Qin is strong. After the lord's hundred years, we can seek to enter there.'

sentences.zh: 遂奔梁。

translations.literal: He then fled to Liang.
translations.idiomatic: He then fled to Liang.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，晉伐翟，翟以重耳故，亦擊晉於齧桑，晉兵解而去。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fifth year, Jin attacked Di. Di, because of Chong Er, also struck Jin at Nie Sang. The Jin troops dispersed and left.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fifth year, Jin attacked Di. Di, because of Chong Er, also struck Jin at Nie Sang. The Jin troops dispersed and left.

sentences.zh: 當此時，晉彊，西有河西，與秦接境，北邊翟，東至河內。

translations.literal: At this time, Jin was strong. In the west it had He Xi, bordering Qin. In the north it bordered Di. In the east it reached He Nei.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Jin was strong. In the west it had He Xi, bordering Qin. In the north it bordered Di. In the east it reached He Nei.

sentences.zh: 驪姬弟生悼子。

translations.literal: Li Ji's younger brother gave birth to Dao Zi.
translations.idiomatic: Li Ji's younger brother gave birth to Dao Zi.

sentences.zh: 二十六年夏，齊桓公大會諸侯於葵丘。

translations.literal: In the twenty-sixth year summer, Qi's Duke Huan held a great assembly of feudal lords at Kui Qiu.
translations.idiomatic: In the summer of the twenty-sixth year, Duke Huan of Qi held a great assembly of feudal lords at Kui Qiu.

sentences.zh: 晉獻公病，行後，未至，逢周之宰孔。

translations.literal: Duke Xian of Jin was ill. He went after, but had not yet arrived when he met Zhou's steward Kong.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xian of Jin was ill. He went after them, but had not yet arrived when he met the Zhou's steward Kong.

sentences.zh: 宰孔曰：「齊桓公益驕，不務德而務遠略，諸侯弗平。

translations.literal: Steward Kong said: 'Qi Huan Gong increasingly arrogant, not attends virtue but attends distant strategies, feudal lords not content.
translations.idiomatic: Steward Kong said: 'Duke Huan of Qi is increasingly arrogant. He does not attend to virtue but attends to distant strategies. The feudal lords are not content.

sentences.zh: 君弟毋會，毋如晉何。」

translations.literal: Lord do not assemble, not as Jin what.'
translations.idiomatic: Lord, do not assemble. There is nothing you can do about Jin.'

sentences.zh: 獻公亦病，復還歸。

translations.literal: Duke Xian was also ill, and again returned home.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xian was also ill, and again returned home.

sentences.zh: 病甚，乃謂荀息曰：「吾以奚齊為後，年少，諸大臣不服，恐亂起，子能立之乎？」

translations.literal: Illness severe, then told Xun Xi said: 'I make Xi Qi successor, year young, various ministers not submit, fear chaos rise, you can establish him?'
translations.idiomatic: When the illness became severe, he then told Xun Xi and said: 'I make Xi Qi my successor, but he is young in years. The various ministers will not submit. I fear chaos will rise. Can you establish him?'

sentences.zh: 荀息曰：「能。」

translations.literal: Xun Xi said: 'Can.'
translations.idiomatic: Xun Xi said: 'I can.'

sentences.zh: 獻公曰：「何以為驗？」

translations.literal: Xian Gong said: 'What to make verification?'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xian said: 'What will serve as verification?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「使死者復生，生者不慚，為之驗。」

translations.literal: Replied said: 'Make dead revive, living not ashamed, make verification.'
translations.idiomatic: He replied and said: 'If the dead can revive and the living are not ashamed, that will serve as verification.'

sentences.zh: 於是遂屬奚齊於荀息。

translations.literal: Thereupon they then entrusted Xi Qi to Xun Xi.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon they then entrusted Xi Qi to Xun Xi.

sentences.zh: 荀息為相，主國政。

translations.literal: Xun Xi became chancellor and controlled the state government.
translations.idiomatic: Xun Xi became chancellor and controlled the state government.

sentences.zh: 秋九月，獻公卒。

translations.literal: In the autumn ninth month, Duke Xian died.
translations.idiomatic: In the autumn ninth month, Duke Xian died.

sentences.zh: 裏克、邳鄭欲內重耳，以三公子之徒作亂，謂荀息曰：「三怨將起，秦、晉輔之，子將何如？」

translations.literal: Li Ke, Pi Zheng desired enter Chong Er, with three princes followers make chaos, told Xun Xi said: 'Three resentments will rise, Qin, Jin help them, you will how?'
translations.idiomatic: Li Ke and Pi Zheng desired to bring in Chong Er. With the three princes' followers making chaos, they told Xun Xi and said: 'Three resentments will rise, and Qin and Jin will help them. What will you do?'

sentences.zh: 荀息曰：「吾不可負先君言。」

translations.literal: Xun Xi said: 'I cannot betray former lord words.'
translations.idiomatic: Xun Xi said: 'I cannot betray the former lord's words.'

sentences.zh: 十月，裏克殺奚齊于喪次，獻公未葬也。

translations.literal: In the tenth month, Li Ke killed Xi Qi at the mourning place. Duke Xian had not yet been buried.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month, Li Ke killed Xi Qi at the mourning place. Duke Xian had not yet been buried.

sentences.zh: 荀息將死之，或曰不如立奚齊弟悼子而傅之，荀息立悼子而葬獻公。

translations.literal: Xun Xi was about to die for it. Someone said it would be better to establish Xi Qi's younger brother Dao Zi and tutor him. Xun Xi established Dao Zi and buried Duke Xian.
translations.idiomatic: Xun Xi was about to die for it. Someone said it would be better to establish Xi Qi's younger brother Dao Zi and tutor him. Xun Xi established Dao Zi and buried the Duke Xian.

sentences.zh: 十一月，裏克弒悼子于朝，荀息死之。

translations.literal: In the eleventh month, Li Ke assassinated Dao Zi in the court. Xun Xi died for it.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh month, Li Ke assassinated Dao Zi in the court. Xun Xi died for it.

sentences.zh: 君子曰：「詩所謂『白珪之玷，猶可磨也，斯言之玷，不可為也』，其荀息之謂乎！

translations.literal: Gentleman said: 'Shi called 'white gui blemish, still can grind, this words blemish, not can do', its Xun Xi speak!
translations.idiomatic: The gentleman said: 'The Shi says: 'A white gui's blemish can still be ground, but this word's blemish cannot be done.' This speaks of Xun Xi!

sentences.zh: 不負其言。」

translations.literal: Not betray his words.'
translations.idiomatic: He did not betray his words.'

sentences.zh: 初，獻公將伐驪戎，卜曰「齒牙為禍」。

translations.literal: Initially, Xian Gong about to attack Li Rong, divination said 'teeth fangs become calamity'.
translations.idiomatic: Initially, when Duke Xian was about to attack the Li Rong, the divination said 'teeth and fangs will become calamity'.

sentences.zh: 及破驪戎，獲驪姬，愛之，竟以亂晉。

translations.literal: When he broke the Li Rong and obtained Li Ji, he loved her. In the end this brought chaos to Jin.
translations.idiomatic: When he broke the Li Rong and obtained Li Ji, he loved her. In the end this brought chaos to Jin.

sentences.zh: 裏克等已殺奚齊、悼子，使人迎公子重耳於翟，欲立之。

translations.literal: Li Ke and others had already killed Xi Qi and Dao Zi. They sent people to welcome Prince Chong Er from Di, desiring to establish him.
translations.idiomatic: Li Ke and others had already killed Xi Qi and Dao Zi. They sent people to welcome Prince Chong Er from the Di, desiring to establish him.

sentences.zh: 重耳謝曰：「負父之命出奔，父死不得修人子之禮侍喪，重耳何敢入！

translations.literal: Chong Er declined said: 'Carried father command fled, father died not able cultivate person son ritual attend mourning, Chong Er how dare enter!
translations.idiomatic: Chong Er declined and said: 'I carried my father's command and fled. When my father died, I was not able to cultivate the person son's ritual and attend mourning. How dare Chong Er enter!

sentences.zh: 大夫其更立他子。」

translations.literal: Grand officers should change establish other son.'
translations.idiomatic: The grand officers should change and establish another son.'

sentences.zh: 還報裏克，裏克使迎夷吾於梁。

translations.literal: They returned and reported to Li Ke. Li Ke made them welcome Yi Wu from Liang.
translations.idiomatic: They returned and reported to Li Ke. Li Ke made them welcome Yi Wu from Liang.

sentences.zh: 夷吾欲往，呂省、郤芮曰：「內猶有公子可立者而外求，難信。

translations.literal: Yi Wu desired go, Lu Sheng, Xi Rui said: 'Inside still have prince can establish and outside seek, difficult trust.
translations.idiomatic: Yi Wu desired to go. Lu Sheng and Xi Rui said: 'Inside there are still princes who can be established, and yet we seek from the outside. This is difficult to trust.

sentences.zh: 計非之秦，輔彊國之威以入，恐危。」

translations.literal: Plan not of Qin, help strong state might to enter, fear danger.'
translations.idiomatic: If the plan is not of Qin, and we help a strong state's might to enter, we fear danger.'

sentences.zh: 乃使郤芮厚賂秦，約曰：「即得入，請以晉河西之地與秦。」

translations.literal: Then made Xi Rui thickly bribe Qin, agreed said: 'If obtain enter, please with Jin He Xi land give Qin.'
translations.idiomatic: Then he made Xi Rui thickly bribe Qin and agreed, saying: 'If we obtain entry, please give the Jin's He Xi land to Qin.'

sentences.zh: 及遺裏克書曰：「誠得立，請遂封子於汾陽之邑。」

translations.literal: And sent Li Ke letter said: 'Truly obtain establish, please then enfeoff son at Fen Yang city.'
translations.idiomatic: And he sent Li Ke a letter and said: 'If I truly obtain establishment, please then enfeoff you at the Fen Yang city.'

sentences.zh: 秦繆公乃發兵送夷吾於晉。

translations.literal: Qin Mu Gong then sent troops to send Yi Wu to Jin.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu of Qin then sent troops to send Yi Wu to Jin.

sentences.zh: 齊桓公聞晉內亂，亦率諸侯如晉。

translations.literal: Qi Huan Gong heard of Jin's internal chaos and also led the feudal lords to go to Jin.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan of Qi heard of Jin's internal chaos and also led the feudal lords to go to Jin.

sentences.zh: 秦兵與夷吾亦至晉，齊乃使隰朋會秦俱入夷吾，立為晉君，是為惠公。

translations.literal: Qin troops with Yi Wu also arrived at Jin. Qi then made Xi Peng meet with Qin to together enter Yi Wu and establish him as Jin's lord, who became Duke Hui.
translations.idiomatic: Qin troops with Yi Wu also arrived at Jin. Qi then made Xi Peng meet with the Qin to together enter Yi Wu and establish him as the Jin's lord, who became Duke Hui.

sentences.zh: 齊桓公至晉之高梁而還歸。

translations.literal: Qi Huan Gong arrived at Jin's Gao Liang and returned home.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan of Qi arrived at Jin's Gao Liang and returned home.

sentences.zh: 惠公夷吾元年，使邳鄭謝秦曰：「始夷吾以河西地許君，今幸得入立。

translations.literal: Hui Gong Yi Wu first year, made Pi Zheng thank Qin said: 'Beginning Yi Wu with He Xi land promised lord, now fortunately obtain enter establish.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Hui Yi Wu's first year, he made Pi Zheng thank Qin and said: 'Beginning, Yi Wu promised the lord the He Xi land. Now I have fortunately obtained entry and establishment.

sentences.zh: 大臣曰：『地者先君之地，君亡在外，何以得擅許秦者？』

translations.literal: Ministers said: 'Land is former lord land, lord fled outside, how obtain monopolize promise Qin?'
translations.idiomatic: The ministers said: 'The land is the former lord's land. When the lord fled outside, how could you obtain the right to monopolize and promise it to Qin?'

sentences.zh: 寡人爭之弗能得，故謝秦。」

translations.literal: I contended it not able obtain, therefore thank Qin.'
translations.idiomatic: I contended it but was not able to obtain it. Therefore, I thank Qin.'

sentences.zh: 亦不與裏克汾陽邑，而奪之權。

translations.literal: He also did not give Li Ke the Fen Yang city, and seized his authority.
translations.idiomatic: He also did not give Li Ke the Fen Yang city, and seized his authority.

sentences.zh: 四月，周襄王使周公忌父會齊、秦大夫共禮晉惠公。

translations.literal: In the fourth month, Zhou Xiang Wang made Zhou Gong Ji Fu meet with Qi and Qin grand officers to together perform rituals for Jin Hui Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth month, King Xiang of Zhou made the Duke of Zhou Ji Fu meet with Qi and Qin grand officers to together perform rituals for Jin's Duke Hui.

sentences.zh: 惠公以重耳在外，畏裏克為變，賜裏克死。

translations.literal: Duke Hui, because Chong Er was outside, feared Li Ke would make rebellion, and granted Li Ke death.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Hui, because Chong Er was outside, feared Li Ke would make rebellion, and granted Li Ke the death.

sentences.zh: 謂曰：「微裏子寡人不得立。

translations.literal: Told said: 'Without Li Zi I not able establish.
translations.idiomatic: He told him and said: 'Without Li Zi, I would not have been able to be established.

sentences.zh: 雖然，子亦殺二君一大夫，為子君者不亦難乎？」

translations.literal: Although, you also killed two lords one grand officer, for your lord not also difficult?'
translations.idiomatic: Although, you also killed two lords and one grand officer. For the lord, is this not also difficult?'

sentences.zh: 裏克對曰：「不有所廢，君何以興？

translations.literal: Li Ke replied said: 'Not have something deposed, lord how rise?
translations.idiomatic: Li Ke replied and said: 'If there is nothing deposed, how can the lord rise?

sentences.zh: 欲誅之，其無辭乎？

translations.literal: Desire execute him, his without words?'
translations.idiomatic: If you desire to execute him, does he not have words?

sentences.zh: 乃言為此！

translations.literal: Then spoke for this!
translations.idiomatic: Then I spoke for this reason, and now you desire to execute me!

sentences.zh: 臣聞命矣。」

translations.literal: Minister heard command.'
translations.idiomatic: This minister has heard the command.'

sentences.zh: 遂伏劍而死。

translations.literal: He then fell on his sword and died.
translations.idiomatic: He then fell on his sword and died.

sentences.zh: 於是邳鄭使謝秦未還，故不及難。

translations.literal: Thereupon Pi Zheng's envoy to thank Qin had not yet returned, therefore he was not caught in the difficulty.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon, Pi Zheng's envoy to thank Qin had not yet returned, therefore he was not caught in the difficulty.

sentences.zh: 晉君改葬恭太子申生。

translations.literal: The Jin lord reburied Crown Prince Gong Shen Sheng.
translations.idiomatic: The Jin lord reburied Crown Prince Gong Shen Sheng.

sentences.zh: 秋，狐突之下國，遇申生，申生與載而告之曰：「夷吾無禮，余得請於帝，將以晉與秦，秦將祀余。」

translations.literal: Autumn, Hu Tu going down to state, met Shen Sheng, Shen Sheng with him rode and told him said: 'Yi Wu without ritual, I obtained request at Emperor, will with Jin give Qin, Qin will sacrifice to me.'
translations.idiomatic: In autumn, when Hu Tu was going down to the state, he met Shen Sheng. Shen Sheng rode with him and told him, saying: 'Yi Wu is without ritual. I obtained a request from the Emperor. I will give Jin to Qin, and Qin will sacrifice to me.'

sentences.zh: 狐突對曰：「臣聞神不食非其宗，君其祀毋乃絕乎？

translations.literal: Hu Tu replied said: 'Minister heard spirits not eat not their ancestral temple, lord your sacrifices perhaps cut off?
translations.idiomatic: Hu Tu replied and said: 'This minister has heard that spirits do not eat from those who are not their ancestral temple. Lord, will the sacrifices not be cut off?

sentences.zh: 君其圖之。」

translations.literal: Lord should plan it.'
translations.idiomatic: Lord, you should plan it.'

sentences.zh: 申生曰：「諾，吾將復請帝。

translations.literal: Shen Sheng said: 'Yes, I will again request Emperor.
translations.idiomatic: Shen Sheng said: 'Yes, I will again request the Emperor.

sentences.zh: 後十日，新城西偏將有巫者見我焉。」

translations.literal: After ten days, Xin Cheng west side will have shaman see me there.'
translations.idiomatic: After ten days, at Xin Cheng's west side, there will be a shaman who sees me there.'

sentences.zh: 許之，遂不見。

translations.literal: He promised it, and then was not seen.
translations.idiomatic: He promised it, and then was not seen.

sentences.zh: 及期而往，復見，申生告之曰：「帝許罰有罪矣，弊於韓。」

translations.literal: And at time went, again seen, Shen Sheng told him said: 'Emperor permitted punish guilty, ended at Han.'
translations.idiomatic: And at the time he went, he again saw him. Shen Sheng told him and said: 'The Emperor has permitted punishing the guilty. It will end at Han.'

sentences.zh: 兒乃謠曰：「恭太子更葬矣，後十四年，晉亦不昌，昌乃在兄。」

translations.literal: Child then sang: 'Gong crown prince reburied, after fourteen years, Jin also not prosperous, prosperity then in elder brother.'
translations.idiomatic: A child then sang: 'Crown Prince Gong has been reburied. After fourteen years, Jin will also not be prosperous. Prosperity will then be in the elder brother.'

sentences.zh: 邳鄭使秦，聞裏克誅，乃說秦繆公曰：「呂省、郤稱、冀芮實為不從。

translations.literal: Pi Zheng envoy to Qin, heard Li Ke executed, then persuaded Qin Mu Gong said: 'Lu Sheng, Xi Cheng, Ji Rui truly are not obedient.
translations.idiomatic: Pi Zheng was an envoy to Qin. When he heard that Li Ke had been executed, he then persuaded Duke Mu of Qin and said: 'Lu Sheng, Xi Cheng, and Ji Rui truly are not obedient.

sentences.zh: 若重賂與謀，出晉君，入重耳，事必就。」

translations.literal: If heavy bribe and plot, expel Jin lord, enter Chong Er, matter must succeed.'
translations.idiomatic: If you heavily bribe and plot, expel the Jin lord, and bring in Chong Er, the matter must succeed.'

sentences.zh: 秦繆公許之，使人與歸報晉，厚賂三子。

translations.literal: Qin Mu Gong permitted it and made people return to report to Jin, thickly bribing the three sons.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu of Qin permitted it and made people return to report to Jin, thickly bribing the three sons.

sentences.zh: 三子曰：「幣厚言甘，此必邳鄭賣我於秦。」

translations.literal: Three sons said: 'Currency thick words sweet, this must Pi Zheng sell us to Qin.'
translations.idiomatic: The three sons said: 'The currency is thick and the words are sweet. This must be Pi Zheng selling us to Qin.'

sentences.zh: 遂殺邳鄭及裏克、邳鄭之黨七輿大夫。

translations.literal: They then killed Pi Zheng and Li Ke, and Pi Zheng's party of seven chariot grand officers.
translations.idiomatic: They then killed Pi Zheng and Li Ke, and Pi Zheng's party of the seven chariot grand officers.

sentences.zh: 邳鄭子豹奔秦，言伐晉，繆公弗聽。

translations.literal: Pi Zheng Zi Bao fled to Qin and spoke of attacking Jin. Mu Gong did not listen.
translations.idiomatic: Pi Zheng's son Bao fled to Qin and spoke of attacking Jin. Duke Mu did not listen to the proposal.

sentences.zh: 惠公之立，倍秦地及裏克，誅七輿大夫，國人不附。

translations.literal: Duke Hui's establishment doubled Qin's land and Li Ke. He executed seven chariot grand officers. The state's people did not attach themselves.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Hui's establishment doubled Qin's land and Li Ke. He executed seven chariot grand officers. The state's people did not attach themselves.

sentences.zh: 二年，周使召公過禮晉惠公，惠公禮倨，召公譏之。

translations.literal: In the second year, Zhou made Shao Gong Guo perform rituals for Jin Hui Gong. Hui Gong's rituals were arrogant. Shao Gong criticized him.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, Zhou made Shao Gong Guo perform rituals for Jin's Duke Hui. Duke Hui's rituals were arrogant. Shao Gong criticized him.

sentences.zh: 四年，晉饑，乞糴於秦。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, Jin suffered famine and begged grain from Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, Jin suffered famine and begged grain from Qin.

sentences.zh: 繆公問百里奚，百里奚曰：「天菑流行，國家代有，救菑恤鄰，國之道也。

translations.literal: Mu Gong asked Bai Li Xi, Bai Li Xi said: 'Heaven calamities circulate, states alternately have, save calamities relieve neighbors, state way.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu asked Bai Li Xi. Bai Li Xi said: 'Heaven's calamities circulate, and states alternately have them. To save calamities and relieve neighbors is the state's way.

sentences.zh: 與之。」

translations.idiomatic: Give to them.'

sentences.zh: 邳鄭子豹曰：「伐之。」

translations.literal: Pi Zheng Zi Bao said: 'Attack them.'
translations.idiomatic: Pi Zheng's son Bao said: 'Attack them.'

sentences.zh: 繆公曰：「其君是惡，其民何罪！」

translations.literal: Mu Gong said: 'Their lord is evil, their people what crime!'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu said: 'Their lord is evil, but what crime have the people committed!'

sentences.zh: 卒與粟，自雍屬絳。

translations.literal: In the end they gave grain, from Yong reaching to Jiang.
translations.idiomatic: In the end they gave grain, from Yong reaching to Jiang.

sentences.zh: 五年，秦饑，請糴於晉。

translations.literal: In the fifth year, Qin suffered famine and requested grain from Jin.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, Qin suffered famine and requested grain from Jin.

sentences.zh: 晉君謀之，慶鄭曰：「以秦得立，已而倍其地約。

translations.literal: Jin lord consulted it, Qing Zheng said: 'With Qin obtained establishment, then doubled their land agreement.
translations.idiomatic: The Jin lord consulted it. Qing Zheng said: 'With Qin we obtained establishment, then we doubled their land agreement.

sentences.zh: 晉饑而秦貸我，今秦饑請糴，與之何疑？

translations.literal: Jin famine and Qin lent us, now Qin famine requests grain, give to them what doubt?
translations.idiomatic: When Jin had famine, Qin lent to us. Now Qin has famine and requests grain. What doubt is there in giving the grain to them?

sentences.zh: 而謀之！」

translations.literal: And plot it!'
translations.idiomatic: And yet you plot against them! This is what I mean!'

sentences.zh: 虢射曰：「往年天以晉賜秦，秦弗知取而貸我。

translations.literal: Guo She said: 'Previous year heaven with Jin granted Qin, Qin not know take and lent us.
translations.idiomatic: Guo She said: 'In previous years, heaven granted Jin to Qin, but the Qin did not know to take it and lent to us.

sentences.zh: 今天以秦賜晉，晉其可以逆天乎？

translations.literal: Today heaven with Qin grants Jin, Jin how can oppose heaven?
translations.idiomatic: Today heaven grants Qin to Jin. How can Jin oppose heaven?

sentences.zh: 遂伐之。」

translations.literal: Then attack them.'
translations.idiomatic: Then attack them.'

sentences.zh: 惠公用虢射謀，不與秦粟，而發兵且伐秦。

translations.literal: Duke Hui used Guo She's plan. He did not give grain to Qin, and sent troops to attack Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Hui used Guo She's plan. He did not give grain to Qin, and sent the troops to attack Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦大怒，亦發兵伐晉。

translations.literal: Qin was greatly angered and also sent troops to attack Jin.
translations.idiomatic: Qin was greatly angered and also sent troops to attack Jin.

sentences.zh: 六年春，秦繆公將兵伐晉。

translations.literal: In the sixth year spring, Qin Mu Gong led troops to attack Jin.
translations.idiomatic: In the spring of the sixth year, Duke Mu of Qin led troops to attack Jin.

sentences.zh: 晉惠公謂慶鄭曰：「秦師深矣，柰何？」

translations.literal: Jin Hui Gong told Qing Zheng said: 'Qin army deep, what to do?'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Hui of Jin told Qing Zheng and said: 'The Qin army is deep. What should we do?'

sentences.zh: 鄭曰：「秦內君，君倍其賂；

translations.literal: Zheng said: 'Qin brought in lord, lord doubled their bribe;
translations.idiomatic: Zheng said: 'Qin brought in the lord, and the lord doubled their bribe;

sentences.zh: 晉饑秦輸粟，秦饑而晉倍之，乃欲因其饑伐之：其深不亦宜乎！」

translations.literal: Jin famine Qin transported grain, Qin famine and Jin doubled it, then desired take advantage famine attack them: their deep not also proper!'
translations.idiomatic: When Jin had famine, Qin transported grain. When Qin had famine, Jin doubled it. Then you desired to take advantage of their famine to attack them. Is the depth not also proper!'

sentences.zh: 晉卜御右，慶鄭皆吉。

translations.literal: Jin divined the chariot driver and right side. Qing Zheng was all auspicious.
translations.idiomatic: Jin divined for the chariot driver and right side. Qing Zheng was all auspicious.

sentences.zh: 公曰：「鄭不孫。」

translations.literal: Gong said: 'Zheng not filial.'
translations.idiomatic: The gong said: 'Zheng is not filial.'

sentences.zh: 乃更令步陽御戎，家仆徒為右，進兵。

translations.literal: He then again commanded Bu Yang to drive the chariot, family slave Tu as the right, and advanced the troops.
translations.idiomatic: He then again commanded Bu Yang to drive the chariot, family slave Tu as the right, and advanced the troops.

sentences.zh: 九月壬戌，秦繆公、晉惠公合戰韓原。

translations.literal: In the ninth month, Ren Xu, Qin Mu Gong and Jin Hui Gong joined battle at Han Yuan.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth month, on Ren Xu, Duke Mu of Qin and Duke Hui of Jin joined battle at Han Yuan.

sentences.zh: 惠公馬騺不行，秦兵至，公窘，召慶鄭為御。

translations.literal: Duke Hui's horse stumbled and would not go. Qin troops arrived. The gong was distressed and summoned Qing Zheng as driver.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Hui's horse stumbled and would not go. Qin troops arrived. The gong was distressed and summoned Qing Zheng as driver.

sentences.zh: 鄭曰：「不用卜，敗不亦當乎！」

translations.literal: Zheng said: 'Not used divination, defeat not also proper!'
translations.idiomatic: Zheng said: 'You did not use the divination. Is defeat not also proper!'

sentences.zh: 遂去。

translations.literal: He then left.
translations.idiomatic: He then left.

sentences.zh: 更令梁繇靡御，虢射為右，輅秦繆公。

translations.literal: He again commanded Liang You Mi to drive, Guo She as right, and pursued Qin Mu Gong.
translations.idiomatic: He again commanded Liang You Mi to drive, Guo She as the right, and pursued Duke Mu of Qin.

sentences.zh: 繆公壯士冒敗晉軍，晉軍敗，遂失秦繆公，反獲晉公以歸。

translations.literal: Mu Gong's strong men braved and defeated the Jin army. The Jin army was defeated. They then lost Qin Mu Gong, but instead captured the Jin gong to return.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu's strong men braved and defeated the Jin army. The Jin army was defeated. They then lost Duke Mu of Qin, but instead captured the Jin gong to return.

sentences.zh: 秦將以祀上帝。

translations.literal: Qin was about to sacrifice him to the Shang Di.
translations.idiomatic: Qin was about to sacrifice him to the Shang Di.

sentences.zh: 晉君姊為繆公夫人，衰绖涕泣。

translations.literal: The Jin lord's elder sister was Mu Gong's wife. She wept in mourning garments.
translations.idiomatic: The Jin lord's elder sister was Duke Mu's wife. She wept in mourning garments.

sentences.zh: 公曰：「得晉侯將以為樂，今乃如此。

translations.literal: Gong said: 'Obtained Jin hou will take as joy, now then like this.
translations.idiomatic: The gong said: 'I obtained the Jin hou and will take it as joy, but now it is like this.

sentences.zh: 且吾聞箕子見唐叔之初封，曰『其後必當大矣』，晉庸可滅乎！」

translations.literal: Moreover I heard Ji Zi saw Tang Shu initial enfeoffment, said 'his descendants must greatly', Jin how can extinguish!'
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, I heard that Ji Zi saw Tang Shu's initial enfeoffment and said 'his descendants must be great.' How can the Jin be extinguished!'

sentences.zh: 乃與晉侯盟王城而許之歸。

translations.literal: He then allied with the Jin hou at Wang Cheng and permitted him to return.
translations.idiomatic: He then allied with the Jin hou at Wang Cheng and permitted him to return.

sentences.zh: 晉侯亦使呂省等報國人曰：「孤雖得歸，毋面目見社稷，卜日立子圉。」

translations.literal: Jin hou also made Lu Sheng etc. report state people said: 'I though obtain return, no face see altars, divine day establish Zi Yu.'
translations.idiomatic: The Jin hou also made Lu Sheng and others report to the state people and said: 'I, though I obtain return, have no face to see the altars. Divine a day and establish Zi Yu.'

sentences.zh: 晉人聞之，皆哭。

translations.literal: The Jin people heard it and all cried.
translations.idiomatic: The Jin people heard it and all cried.

sentences.zh: 秦繆公問呂省：「晉國和乎？」

translations.literal: Qin Mu Gong asked Lu Sheng: 'Jin state harmonious?'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu of Qin asked Lu Sheng: 'Is the Jin state harmonious?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「不和。

translations.literal: Replied said: 'Not harmonious.
translations.idiomatic: He replied and said: 'It is not harmonious.

sentences.zh: 小人懼失君亡親，不憚立子圉，曰『必報讎，寧事戎、狄』。

translations.literal: Small people fear lose lord lose kin, not dread establish Zi Yu, said 'must avenge enmity, rather serve Rong, Di'.
translations.idiomatic: Small people fear losing the lord and losing kin. They do not dread establishing Zi Yu and said 'we must avenge enmity, rather serve Rong and Di'.

sentences.zh: 其君子則愛君而知罪，以待秦命，曰『必報德』。

translations.literal: Their gentlemen then love lord and know guilt, to await Qin command, said 'must repay virtue'.
translations.idiomatic: Their gentlemen then love the lord and know guilt, to await the Qin command, and said 'we must repay virtue'.

translations.literal: Have these two reasons, not harmonious.'
translations.idiomatic: Having these two reasons, it is not harmonious.'

sentences.zh: 於是秦繆公更舍晉惠公，餽之七牢。

translations.literal: Thereupon Qin Mu Gong again lodged Jin Hui Gong and gifted him seven sets of animals.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon Duke Mu of Qin again lodged Duke Hui of Jin and gifted him the seven sets of animals.

sentences.zh: 十一月，歸晉侯。

translations.literal: In the eleventh month, they returned the Jin hou.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh month, they returned the Jin hou.

sentences.zh: 晉侯至國，誅慶鄭，修政教。

translations.literal: The Jin hou arrived in the state, executed Qing Zheng, and repaired the government teachings.
translations.idiomatic: The Jin hou arrived in the state, executed Qing Zheng, and repaired the government teachings.

sentences.zh: 謀曰：「重耳在外，諸侯多利內之。」

translations.literal: Consulted said: 'Chong Er outside, feudal lords many profit bring in him.'
translations.idiomatic: They consulted and said: 'Chong Er is outside, and many feudal lords profit from bringing the him in.'

sentences.zh: 欲使人殺重耳於狄。

translations.literal: He desired to make people kill Chong Er at Di.
translations.idiomatic: He desired to make people kill Chong Er at Di.

sentences.zh: 重耳聞之，如齊。

translations.literal: Chong Er heard of it and went to Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Chong Er heard of it and went to Qi.

sentences.zh: 八年，使太子圉質秦。

translations.literal: In the eighth year, he made Crown Prince Yu a hostage in Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, he made Crown Prince Yu a hostage in Qin.

sentences.zh: 初，惠公亡在梁，梁伯以其女妻之，生一男一女。

translations.literal: Initially, when Hui Gong fled in Liang, Liang Bo married his daughter to him. She gave birth to one male and one female.
translations.idiomatic: Initially, when Duke Hui fled in Liang, Liang Bo married his daughter to him. She gave birth to a male and a female.

sentences.zh: 梁伯卜之，男為人臣，女為人妾，故名男為圉，女為妾。

translations.literal: Liang Bo divined it. The male would be a minister to others, the female a concubine to others. Therefore he named the male Yu and the female Concubine.
translations.idiomatic: Liang Bo divined it. The male would be a minister to others, the female a concubine to others. Therefore he named the male Yu and the female Concubine.

sentences.zh: 十年，秦滅梁。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, Qin extinguished Liang.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, Qin extinguished Liang.

sentences.zh: 梁伯好土功，治城溝，民力罷怨，其眾數相驚，曰「秦寇至」，民恐惑，秦竟滅之。

translations.literal: Liang bo liked earth works, managed city moats, people strength exhausted resented, their multitudes several times mutually alarmed, said 'Qin bandits arrive', people feared bewildered, Qin finally extinguished it.
translations.idiomatic: Liang Bo liked earth works and managed city moats. The people's strength was exhausted and resented. Their multitudes several times mutually alarmed, saying 'Qin bandits arrive'. The people feared and were bewildered. Qin finally extinguished it.

sentences.zh: 十三年，晉惠公病，內有數子。

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, Jin Hui Gong was ill. He had several sons inside.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, Duke Hui of Jin was ill. He had several sons inside.

sentences.zh: 太子圉曰：「吾母家在梁，梁今秦滅之，我外輕於秦而內無援於國。

translations.literal: Crown prince Yu said: 'My mother family in Liang, Liang now Qin extinguished it, I outside light to Qin and inside no aid in state.
translations.idiomatic: Crown Prince Yu said: 'My mother's family is in Liang. Liang has now been extinguished by Qin. I am light to Qin outside and have no aid inside the state.

sentences.zh: 君即不起，病大夫輕，更立他公子。」

translations.literal: Lord if not rise, ill grand officers light, change establish other prince.'
translations.idiomatic: If the lord does not rise, the ill grand officers are light, and they will change and establish another prince.'

sentences.zh: 乃謀與其妻俱亡歸。

translations.literal: He then plotted with his wife to together flee and return.
translations.idiomatic: He then plotted with his wife to together flee and return.

sentences.zh: 秦女曰：「子一國太子，辱在此。

translations.literal: Qin woman said: 'You one state crown prince, humiliated here.
translations.idiomatic: The Qin woman said: 'You are one state's crown prince, humiliated here.

sentences.zh: 秦使婢子侍，以固子之心。

translations.literal: Qin made a maidservant attend, to strengthen your heart.
translations.idiomatic: Qin made a maidservant attend, to strengthen your heart.

sentences.zh: 子亡矣，我不從子，亦不敢言。」

translations.literal: You flee, I not follow you, also not dare speak.'
translations.idiomatic: If you flee, I will not follow you, and also I will not dare to speak.'

sentences.zh: 子圉遂亡歸晉。

translations.literal: Zi Yu then fled and returned to Jin.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Yu then fled and returned to Jin.

sentences.zh: 十四年九月，惠公卒，太子圉立，是為懷公。

translations.literal: In the fourteenth year ninth month, Hui Gong died. Crown Prince Yu was established, who became Duke Huai.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth month of the fourteenth year, Duke Hui died. Crown Prince Yu was established and became Duke Huai.

sentences.zh: 子圉之亡，秦怨之，乃求公子重耳，欲內之。

translations.literal: Zi Yu fled. Qin resented it and then sought Prince Chong Er, desiring to bring him in.
translations.idiomatic: When Zi Yu fled, the state of Qin resented it and then sought Prince Chong Er, desiring to bring him in.

sentences.zh: 子圉之立，畏秦之伐也。

translations.literal: Zi Yu's establishment feared Qin's attack.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Yu's establishment feared Qin's attack.

sentences.zh: 乃令國中諸從重耳亡者與期，期盡不到者盡滅其家。

translations.literal: He then commanded those in the state who had followed Chong Er in flight to set a deadline. Those who did not arrive by the deadline would have their families completely extinguished.
translations.idiomatic: He then commanded those in the state who had followed Chong Er in flight to set a deadline. Those who did not arrive by the deadline would have their families completely extinguished.

sentences.zh: 狐突之子毛及偃從重耳在秦，弗肯召。

translations.literal: Hu Tu's sons Mao and Yan followed Chong Er in Qin and were not willing to be summoned.
translations.idiomatic: Hu Tu's sons Mao and Yan followed Chong Er in the state of Qin and were not willing to be summoned.

sentences.zh: 懷公怒，囚狐突。

translations.literal: Duke Huai was angered and imprisoned Hu Tu.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huai was angered and imprisoned Hu Tu.

sentences.zh: 突曰：「臣子事重耳有年數矣，今召之，是教之反君也。

translations.literal: Tu said: 'Minister sons served Chong Er have years number, now summon them, this teaches them oppose lord.
translations.idiomatic: Tu said: 'My minister sons have served Chong Er for many years. Now if I summon them, this teaches them to oppose the lord.

sentences.zh: 何以教之？」

translations.literal: How teach them?'
translations.idiomatic: How can I teach them that?'

sentences.zh: 懷公卒殺狐突。

translations.literal: Duke Huai finally killed Hu Tu.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huai finally killed Hu Tu.

sentences.zh: 秦繆公乃發兵送內重耳，使人告欒、郤之黨為內應，殺懷公於高梁，入重耳。

translations.literal: Qin Mu Gong then sent troops to bring in Chong Er. He made people tell the Luan and Xi party to act as inner support, killed Duke Huai at Gao Liang, and entered Chong Er.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu of Qin then sent troops to bring in Chong Er. He made people tell the Luan and Xi party to act as inner support, killed Duke Huai at Gao Liang, and brought Chong Er in.

sentences.zh: 重耳立，是為文公。

translations.literal: Chong Er was established, who became Duke Wen.
translations.idiomatic: Chong Er was established and became Duke Wen.

sentences.zh: 晉文公重耳，晉獻公之子也。

translations.literal: Jin Wen Gong Chong Er was Jin Xian Gong's son.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Wen of Jin, Chong Er, was Duke Xian of Jin's son.

sentences.zh: 自少好士，年十七，有賢士五人：曰趙衰；

translations.literal: From young liked scholars, year seventeen, had worthy scholars five people: said Zhao Cui;
translations.idiomatic: From a young age he liked scholars. At the age of seventeen, he had five worthy scholars: Zhao Cui;

sentences.zh: 狐偃咎犯，文公舅也；

translations.literal: Hu Yan Jiu Fan, Wen Gong maternal uncle;
translations.idiomatic: Hu Yan Jiu Fan, Duke Wen's maternal uncle;

translations.idiomatic: Jia Tuo;

translations.literal: Xian Zhen;
translations.idiomatic: Xian Zhen;

translations.idiomatic: Wei Wu Zi.
