translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, they attacked Qin and captured the Qin general Chi.

sentences.zh: 七年，成公與楚莊王爭彊，會諸侯于扈。

translations.literal: In the seventh year, Cheng Gong contended in strength with Chu Zhuang Wang and met the feudal lords at Hu.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, Duke Cheng contended in strength with King Zhuang of Chu and met the feudal lords at Hu.

sentences.zh: 陳畏楚，不會。

translations.literal: Chen feared Chu and did not attend.
translations.idiomatic: Chen feared Chu and did not attend.

sentences.zh: 晉使中行桓子伐陳，因救鄭，與楚戰，敗楚師。

translations.literal: Jin sent Zhong Xing Huan Zi to attack Chen, then to save Zheng. They battled with Chu and defeated the Chu army.
translations.idiomatic: Jin sent Zhong Xing Huan Zi to attack Chen, then to save Zheng. They battled with Chu and defeated the Chu army.

sentences.zh: 是年，成公卒，子景公據立。

translations.literal: That year, Cheng Gong died, and his son Jing Gong Ju was established.
translations.idiomatic: That year, Duke Cheng died, and his son Duke Jing Ju was established.

sentences.zh: 景公元年春，陳大夫夏徵舒弒其君靈公。

translations.literal: In Jing Gong's first year, spring, Chen grandee Xia Zheng Shu assassinated his lord Ling Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the spring of Duke Jing's first year, the Chen grandee Xia Zheng Shu assassinated his lord Duke Ling.

sentences.zh: 二年，楚莊王伐陳，誅徵舒。

translations.literal: In the second year, Chu Zhuang Wang attacked Chen and executed Zheng Shu.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, King Zhuang of Chu attacked Chen and executed Zheng Shu.

sentences.zh: 三年，楚莊王圍鄭，鄭告急晉。

translations.literal: In the third year, Chu Zhuang Wang surrounded Zheng, and Zheng urgently reported to Jin.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, King Zhuang of Chu surrounded Zheng, and Zheng urgently reported to Jin.

sentences.zh: 晉使荀林父將中軍，隨會將上軍，趙朔將下軍，郤克、欒書、先縠、韓厥、鞏朔佐之。

translations.literal: Jin sent Xun Lin Fu to lead the middle army, Sui Hui to lead the upper army, Zhao Shuo to lead the lower army, with Xi Ke, Luan Shu, Xian Hu, Han Jue, and Gong Shuo assisting them.
translations.idiomatic: Jin sent Xun Lin Fu to lead the middle army, Sui Hui to lead the upper army, Zhao Shuo to lead the lower army, with Xi Ke, Luan Shu, Xian Hu, Han Jue, and Gong Shuo assisting them.

sentences.zh: 六月，至河。

translations.literal: In the sixth month, they arrived at the river.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth month, they arrived at the river.

sentences.zh: 聞楚已服鄭，鄭伯肉袒與盟而去，荀林父欲還。

translations.literal: Heard that Chu had already subjugated Zheng. The Zheng lord bared his flesh, allied with them, and departed. Xun Lin Fu desired to return.
translations.idiomatic: They heard that Chu had already subjugated Zheng. The Zheng lord bared his flesh, allied with them, and departed. Xun Lin Fu desired to return.

sentences.zh: 先縠曰：「凡來救鄭，不至不可，將率離心。」

translations.literal: Xian Hu said: 'All came save Zheng, not arrive not permissible, generals officers separate hearts.'
translations.idiomatic: Xian Hu said: 'All came to save Zheng. Not to arrive is not permissible. The generals and officers will have separate hearts.'

sentences.zh: 卒度河。

translations.literal: They ultimately crossed the river.
translations.idiomatic: They ultimately crossed the river.

sentences.zh: 楚已服鄭，欲飲馬于河為名而去。

translations.literal: Chu had already subjugated Zheng and desired to water their horses at the river for reputation and depart.
translations.idiomatic: Chu had already subjugated Zheng and desired to water their horses at the river for reputation and depart.

sentences.zh: 楚與晉軍大戰。

translations.literal: Chu fought a great battle with the Jin army.
translations.idiomatic: Chu fought a great battle with the Jin army.

sentences.zh: 鄭新附楚，畏之，反助楚攻晉。

translations.literal: Zheng had newly attached to Chu. They feared it and instead helped Chu attack Jin.
translations.idiomatic: Zheng had newly attached to Chu. They feared it and instead helped Chu attack Jin.

sentences.zh: 晉軍敗，走河，爭度，船中人指甚眾。

translations.literal: The Jin army was defeated and fled to the river. They contended to cross, and the boats had very many people pointing.
translations.idiomatic: The Jin army was defeated and fled to the river. They contended to cross, and the boats had very many people pointing.

sentences.zh: 楚虜我將智罃。

translations.literal: Chu captured our general Zhi Ying.
translations.idiomatic: Chu captured our general Zhi Ying.

sentences.zh: 歸而林父曰：「臣為督將，軍敗當誅，請死。」

translations.literal: Returned and Lin Fu said: 'Minister was commander general, army defeated should execute, request death.'
translations.idiomatic: When they returned, Lin Fu said: 'Your minister was the commander general. The army was defeated and should be executed. I request death.'

sentences.zh: 景公欲許之。

translations.literal: Jing Gong desired to permit it.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jing desired to permit it.

sentences.zh: 隨會曰：「昔文公之與楚戰城濮，成王歸殺子玉，而文公乃喜。

translations.literal: Sui Hui said: 'Former Wen Gong with Chu battle Cheng Pu, Cheng Wang returned killed Zi Yu, and Wen Gong then happy.
translations.idiomatic: Sui Hui said: 'Formerly, when Duke Wen battled with Chu at the place of Cheng Pu, King Cheng returned and killed Zi Yu, and Duke Wen then was happy.

sentences.zh: 今楚已敗我師，又誅其將，是助楚殺仇也。」

translations.literal: Now Chu already defeated our army, again execute their general, this assists Chu kill enemy.'
translations.idiomatic: Now Chu has already defeated our army. If we again execute their general, this assists Chu in killing the enemy.'

sentences.zh: 乃止。

translations.literal: They then stopped.
translations.idiomatic: They then stopped.

sentences.zh: 四年，先縠以首計而敗晉軍河上，恐誅，乃奔翟，與翟謀伐晉。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, Xian Hu with a rash plan defeated the Jin army on the river upper. He feared execution, so fled to Di and plotted with Di to attack Jin.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, Xian Hu with a rash plan defeated the Jin army on the river. He feared execution, so fled to Di and plotted with Di to attack Jin.

sentences.zh: 晉覺，乃族縠。

translations.literal: Jin became aware and then exterminated Hu's clan.
translations.idiomatic: Jin became aware and then exterminated Hu's clan.

sentences.zh: 縠，先軫子也。

translations.literal: Hu was Xian Zhen's son.
translations.idiomatic: Hu was Xian Zhen's son.

sentences.zh: 五年，伐鄭，為助楚故也。

translations.literal: In the fifth year, attacked Zheng because of assisting Chu.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, they attacked Zheng because Zheng had assisted Chu.

sentences.zh: 是時楚莊王彊，以挫晉兵河上也。

translations.literal: At this time Chu Zhuang Wang was strong, because he had frustrated the Jin troops on the river upper.
translations.idiomatic: At this time King Zhuang of Chu was strong, because he had frustrated the Jin troops on the river.

sentences.zh: 六年，楚伐宋，宋來告急晉，晉欲救之，伯宗謀曰：「楚，天方開之，不可當。」

translations.literal: Sixth year, Chu attacked Song, Song came report urgent Jin, Jin desired save it, Bo Zong advised said: 'Chu, heaven just opening it, not resistable.'
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, Chu attacked Song. Song came to urgently report to Jin. Jin desired to save it, but Bo Zong advised and said: 'Chu—heaven is just opening it. It cannot be resisted.'

sentences.zh: 乃使解揚紿為救宋。

translations.literal: They then sent Xie Yang Dai to save Song.
translations.idiomatic: They then sent Xie Yang Dai to save Song.

sentences.zh: 鄭人執與楚，楚厚賜，使反其言，令宋急下。

translations.literal: The Zheng people seized him and gave him to Chu. Chu thickly rewarded him and made him reverse his words, ordering Song to urgently submit.
translations.idiomatic: The Zheng people seized him and gave him to Chu. Chu thickly rewarded him and made him reverse his words, ordering Song to urgently submit.

sentences.zh: 解揚紿許之，卒致晉君言。

translations.literal: Xie Yang Dai permitted it and ultimately conveyed the Jin lord's words.
translations.idiomatic: Xie Yang Dai permitted it and ultimately conveyed the Jin lord's words.

sentences.zh: 楚欲殺之，或諫，乃歸解揚。

translations.literal: Chu desired to kill him. Some advised, so they returned Xie Yang.
translations.idiomatic: Chu desired to kill him. Some advised against it, so they returned Xie Yang.

sentences.zh: 七年，晉使隨會滅赤狄。

translations.literal: In the seventh year, Jin sent Sui Hui to extinguish the Chi Di.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, Jin sent Sui Hui to extinguish the Chi Di.

sentences.zh: 八年，使郤克於齊。

translations.literal: In the eighth year, sent Xi Ke to Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, they sent Xi Ke to Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊頃公母從樓上觀而笑之。

translations.literal: Qi Qing Gong's mother observed from the tower and laughed at him.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Qing of Qi's mother observed from the tower and laughed at him.

sentences.zh: 所以然者，郤克僂，而魯使蹇，衛使眇，故齊亦令人如之以導客。

translations.literal: The reason was that Xi Ke was hunchbacked, but the Lu envoy was lame, the Wei envoy was one-eyed. Therefore Qi also made people like that to guide the guests.
translations.idiomatic: The reason was that Xi Ke was hunchbacked, but the Lu envoy was lame, and the Wei envoy was one-eyed. Therefore Qi also made people like that to guide the guests.

sentences.zh: 郤克怒，歸至河上，曰：「不報齊者，河伯視之！」

translations.literal: Xi Ke angered, returned to river upper, said: 'Not repay Qi ones, river lord see it!'
translations.idiomatic: Xi Ke was angered, returned to the river, and said: 'If I do not repay Qi, may the river lord see it!'

sentences.zh: 至國，請君，欲伐齊。

translations.literal: He arrived in the country and requested the lord, desiring to attack Qi.
translations.idiomatic: He arrived in the country and requested the lord, desiring to attack Qi.

sentences.zh: 景公問知其故，曰：「子之怨，安足以煩國！」

translations.literal: Jing Gong asked knew its reason, said: 'Your resentment, how suffices trouble country!'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jing asked and knew its reason, and said: 'Your resentment—how can it suffice to trouble the country!'

sentences.zh: 弗聽。

translations.literal: He did not listen.
translations.idiomatic: He did not listen.

sentences.zh: 魏文子請老休，辟郤克，克執政。

translations.literal: Wei Wen Zi requested to retire in old age and avoided Xi Ke. Ke governed.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Wen Zi requested to retire in old age and avoided Xi Ke. Ke governed.

sentences.zh: 九年，楚莊王卒。

translations.literal: In the ninth year, Chu Zhuang Wang died.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, King Zhuang of Chu died.

sentences.zh: 晉伐齊，齊使太子彊為質於晉，晉兵罷。

translations.literal: Jin attacked Qi. Qi sent crown prince Qiang as hostage to Jin, and Jin troops were dismissed.
translations.idiomatic: Jin attacked Qi. Qi sent the crown prince Qiang as a hostage to Jin, and the Jin troops were dismissed.

sentences.zh: 十一年春，齊伐魯，取隆。

translations.literal: In the eleventh year, spring, Qi attacked Lu and took Long.
translations.idiomatic: In the spring of the eleventh year, Qi attacked Lu and took Long.

sentences.zh: 魯告急衛，衛與魯皆因郤克告急於晉。

translations.literal: Lu reported urgent to Wei. Wei and Lu both through Xi Ke reported urgent to Jin.
translations.idiomatic: Lu urgently reported to Wei. Wei and Lu both through Xi Ke urgently reported to the state of Jin.

sentences.zh: 晉乃使郤克、欒書、韓厥以兵車八百乘與魯、衛共伐齊。

translations.literal: Jin then sent Xi Ke, Luan Shu, and Han Jue with eight hundred war chariots and Lu and Wei together to attack Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Jin then sent Xi Ke, Luan Shu, and Han Jue with eight hundred war chariots, and together with the states of Lu and Wei, they attacked Qi.

sentences.zh: 夏，與頃公戰於砹傷困頃公。

translations.literal: In summer, they battled with Qing Gong at Ai, injured and trapped Qing Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In summer, they battled with Duke Qing at Ai, injured him, and trapped Duke Qing.

sentences.zh: 頃公乃與其右易位，下取飲，以得脫去。

translations.literal: Qing Gong then exchanged position with his right-hand man, descended and took a drink, in order to obtain escape and depart.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Qing then exchanged position with his right-hand man, descended and took a drink, in order to escape and depart.

sentences.zh: 齊師敗走，晉追北至齊。

translations.literal: The Qi army was defeated and fled. Jin pursued north to Qi.
translations.idiomatic: The Qi army was defeated and fled. Jin pursued them north to Qi.

sentences.zh: 頃公獻寶器以求平，不聽。

translations.literal: Qing Gong offered treasure vessels to seek peace, but they did not listen.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Qing offered treasure vessels to seek peace, but they did not listen.

sentences.zh: 郤克曰：「必得蕭桐姪子為質。」

translations.literal: Xi Ke said: 'Must obtain Xiao Tong nephew son as hostage.'
translations.idiomatic: Xi Ke said: 'We must obtain Xiao Tong's nephew as a hostage.'

sentences.zh: 齊使曰：「蕭桐姪子，頃公母；

translations.literal: Qi envoy said: 'Xiao Tong nephew son, Qing Gong mother;
translations.idiomatic: The Qi envoy said: 'Xiao Tong's nephew is Duke Qing's mother;

sentences.zh: 頃公母猶晉君母，柰何必得之？

translations.literal: Qing Gong mother like Jin lord mother, how must obtain her?
translations.idiomatic: Duke Qing's mother is like the Jin lord's mother. How can we obtain her?

sentences.zh: 不義，請復戰。」

translations.literal: Not righteous, request again battle.'
translations.idiomatic: This is not righteous. We request to battle again.'

sentences.zh: 晉乃許與平而去。

translations.literal: Jin then permitted peace and departed.
translations.idiomatic: Jin then permitted peace and departed.

sentences.zh: 楚申公巫臣盜夏姬以奔晉，晉以巫臣為邢大夫。

translations.literal: Chu Shen Gong Wu Chen stole Xia Ji to flee to Jin. Jin made Wu Chen Xing's grandee.
translations.idiomatic: Chu's Shen Gong Wu Chen stole Xia Ji and fled to Jin. Jin made Wu Chen a grandee of Xing.

sentences.zh: 十二年冬，齊頃公如晉，欲上尊晉景公為王，景公讓不敢。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, winter, Qi Qing Gong went to Jin and desired to advance and honor Jin Jing Gong as king. Jing Gong declined and dared not.
translations.idiomatic: In the winter of the twelfth year, Duke Qing of Qi went to Jin and desired to advance and honor Duke Jing of Jin as king. Duke Jing declined and dared not.

sentences.zh: 晉始作六（卿）［軍］，韓厥、鞏朔、趙穿、荀騅、趙括、趙旃皆為卿。

translations.literal: Jin began to make six armies. Han Jue, Gong Shuo, Zhao Chuan, Xun Hui, Zhao Kuo, and Zhao Zhan all became ministers.
translations.idiomatic: Jin began to make six armies. Han Jue, Gong Shuo, Zhao Chuan, Xun Hui, Zhao Kuo, and Zhao Zhan all became ministers of the state.

sentences.zh: 智罃自楚歸。

translations.literal: Zhi Ying returned from Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Zhi Ying returned from Chu.

sentences.zh: 十三年，魯成公朝晉，晉弗敬，魯怒去，倍晉。

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, Lu Cheng Gong attended court at Jin. Jin was not respectful. Lu angered and departed, doubling-crossed Jin.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, Duke Cheng of Lu attended court at Jin. Jin was not respectful. Lu was angered and departed, double-crossing Jin.

sentences.zh: 晉伐鄭，取氾。

translations.literal: Jin attacked Zheng and took Fan.
translations.idiomatic: Jin attacked Zheng and took Fan.

sentences.zh: 十四年，梁山崩。

translations.literal: In the fourteenth year, Liang Mountain collapsed.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year, Liang Mountain collapsed.

sentences.zh: 問伯宗，伯宗以為不足怪也。

translations.literal: They asked Bo Zong, and Bo Zong considered it not sufficiently strange.
translations.idiomatic: They asked Bo Zong, and Bo Zong considered it not sufficiently strange.

sentences.zh: 十六年，楚將子反怨巫臣，滅其族。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, Chu general Zi Fan resented Wu Chen and extinguished his clan.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, the Chu general Zi Fan resented Wu Chen and extinguished his clan.

sentences.zh: 巫臣怒，遺子反書曰：「必令子罷於奔命！」

translations.literal: Wu Chen angered, sent Zi Fan letter said: 'Must make you weary at running orders!'
translations.idiomatic: Wu Chen was angered, sent Zi Fan a letter, and said: 'I will make you weary from running orders!'

sentences.zh: 乃請使吳，令其子為吳行人，教吳乘車用兵。

translations.literal: He then requested to be envoy to Wu, ordered his son to become Wu's herald, and taught Wu to ride chariots and use troops.
translations.idiomatic: He then requested to be an envoy to Wu, ordered his son to become Wu's herald, and taught Wu to ride chariots and use troops.

sentences.zh: 吳晉始通，約伐楚。

translations.literal: Wu and Jin began communication and allied to attack Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Wu and Jin began communication and allied to attack Chu.

sentences.zh: 十七年，誅趙同、趙括，族滅之。

translations.literal: In the seventeenth year, they executed Zhao Tong and Zhao Kuo, extinguishing their clan.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventeenth year, they executed Zhao Tong and Zhao Kuo, extinguishing their clan.

sentences.zh: 韓厥曰：「趙衰、趙盾之功豈可忘乎？

translations.literal: Han Jue said: 'Zhao Shuai, Zhao Dun merit how can forget?
translations.idiomatic: Han Jue said: 'How can we forget the merit of Zhao Shuai and Zhao Dun?

sentences.zh: 柰何絕祀！」

translations.literal: How cut off sacrifices!'
translations.idiomatic: How can we cut off their sacrifices!'

sentences.zh: 乃復令趙庶子武為趙後，復與之邑。

translations.literal: They then again ordered Zhao's secondary son Wu to become Zhao's successor and again gave him a city.
translations.idiomatic: They then again ordered Zhao's secondary son Wu to become Zhao's successor and again gave him a city.

sentences.zh: 十九年夏，景公病，立其太子壽曼為君，是為厲公。

translations.literal: In the nineteenth year, summer, Jing Gong was ill and established his crown prince Shou Man as lord. This was Li Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the summer of the nineteenth year, Duke Jing was ill and established his crown prince Shou Man as lord. This was Duke Li.

sentences.zh: 後月餘，景公卒。

translations.literal: A month later, Jing Gong died.
translations.idiomatic: A month later, Duke Jing died.

sentences.zh: 厲公元年，初立，欲和諸侯，與秦桓公夾河而盟。

translations.literal: In Li Gong's first year, newly established, he desired to harmonize the feudal lords and allied with Qin Huan Gong flanking the river.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Li's first year, newly established, he desired to harmonize the feudal lords and allied with Duke Huan of Qin, flanking the river.

sentences.zh: 歸而秦倍盟，與翟謀伐晉。

translations.literal: Upon returning, Qin doubled-crossed the alliance and plotted with Di to attack Jin.
translations.idiomatic: Upon returning, Qin double-crossed the alliance and plotted with Di to attack Jin.

sentences.zh: 三年，使呂相讓秦，因與諸侯伐秦。

translations.literal: Third year, sent Lü Xiang berate Qin, then with feudal lords attacked Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, they sent Lü Xiang to berate Qin, then with the feudal lords attacked Qin.

sentences.zh: 至涇，敗秦於麻隧，虜其將成差。

translations.literal: They arrived at Jing, defeated Qin at Ma Sui, and captured their general Cheng Chai.
translations.idiomatic: They arrived at Jing, defeated Qin at Ma Sui, and captured their general Cheng Chai.

sentences.zh: 五年，三郤讒伯宗，殺之。

translations.literal: In the fifth year, the three Xi slandered Bo Zong and killed him.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, the three Xi slandered Bo Zong and killed him.

sentences.zh: 伯宗以好直諫得此禍，國人以是不附厲公。

translations.literal: Bo Zong obtained this calamity because of his upright admonitions. The people of the state therefore did not attach themselves to Li Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Bo Zong obtained this calamity because of his upright admonitions. The people of the state therefore did not attach themselves to Duke Li.

sentences.zh: 六年春，鄭倍晉與楚盟，晉怒。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, spring, Zheng double-crossed Jin and allied with Chu. Jin was angered.
translations.idiomatic: In the spring of the sixth year, Zheng double-crossed Jin and allied with Chu. Jin was angered.

sentences.zh: 欒書曰：「不可以當吾世而失諸侯。」

translations.literal: Luan Shu said: 'Cannot during our generation lose feudal lords.'
translations.idiomatic: Luan Shu said: 'We cannot during our generation lose the feudal lords.'

sentences.zh: 乃發兵。

translations.literal: They then dispatched troops.
translations.idiomatic: They then dispatched troops.

sentences.zh: 厲公自將，五月度河。

translations.literal: Li Gong personally led the army. In the fifth month they crossed the river.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Li personally led the army. In the fifth month they crossed the river.

sentences.zh: 聞楚兵來救，范文子請公欲還。

translations.literal: They heard that Chu troops had come to save them. Fan Wen Zi requested that the duke return.
translations.idiomatic: They heard that Chu troops had come to save them. Fan Wen Zi requested that the duke return.

sentences.zh: 郤至曰：「發兵誅逆，見彊辟之，無以令諸侯。」

translations.literal: Xi Zhi said: 'Dispatched troops execute rebellious, see strong avoid it, no way command feudal lords.'
translations.idiomatic: Xi Zhi said: 'We have dispatched troops to execute the rebellious. If we see the strong and avoid them, we have no way to command the feudal lords.'

sentences.zh: 遂與戰。

translations.literal: They then battled with them.
translations.idiomatic: They then battled with them.

sentences.zh: 癸巳，射中楚共王目，楚兵敗於鄢陵。

translations.literal: On Gui Si, they shot and hit Chu Gong Wang's eye. Chu troops were defeated at Yan Ling.
translations.idiomatic: On Gui Si, they shot and hit King Gong of Chu's eye. The Chu troops were defeated at Yan Ling.

sentences.zh: 子反收餘兵，拊循欲復戰，晉患之。

translations.literal: Zi Fan gathered the remaining troops and stroked and consoled them, desiring to battle again. Jin was troubled by it.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Fan gathered the remaining troops and stroked and consoled them, desiring to battle again. Jin was troubled by it.

sentences.zh: 共王召子反，其侍者豎陽穀進酒，子反醉，不能見。

translations.literal: Gong Wang summoned Zi Fan. His attendant Shu Yang Gu presented wine. Zi Fan got drunk and could not meet with him.
translations.idiomatic: King Gong summoned Zi Fan. His attendant Shu Yang Gu presented wine. Zi Fan got drunk and could not meet with the king.

sentences.zh: 王怒，讓子反，子反死。

translations.literal: The wang was angered and reproached Zi Fan. Zi Fan died.
translations.idiomatic: The king was angered and reproached Zi Fan. Zi Fan died.

sentences.zh: 王遂引兵歸。

translations.literal: The wang then led the troops and returned.
translations.idiomatic: The king then led the troops and returned.

sentences.zh: 晉由此威諸侯，欲以令天下求霸。

translations.literal: Jin from this awed the feudal lords and desired to command the world and seek hegemony.
translations.idiomatic: Jin from this awed the feudal lords and desired to command the world and seek hegemony.

sentences.zh: 厲公多外嬖姬，歸，欲盡去群大夫而立諸姬兄弟。

translations.literal: Li Gong had many external favored consorts. Upon returning, he desired to completely remove the group of grandees and establish his various consorts' brothers.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Li had many external favored consorts. Upon returning, he desired to completely remove the group of grandees and establish his various consorts' brothers.

sentences.zh: 寵姬兄曰胥童，嘗與郤至有怨，及欒書又怨郤至不用其計而遂敗楚，乃使人閒謝楚。

translations.literal: The favored consort's brother was named Xu Tong. He once had resentment with Xi Zhi, and Luan Shu again resented Xi Zhi for not using his plan and then defeating Chu. He then sent people to secretly apologize to Chu.
translations.idiomatic: The favored consort's brother was named Xu Tong. He once had resentment with Xi Zhi, and Luan Shu again resented Xi Zhi for not using his plan and then defeating Chu. He then sent people to secretly apologize to Chu.

sentences.zh: 楚來詐厲公曰：「鄢陵之戰，實至召楚，欲作亂，內子周立之。

translations.literal: Chu came deceived Li Gong said: 'Yan Ling battle, Xi Zhi summoned Chu, desired make rebellion, inner son Zhou establish him.
translations.idiomatic: Chu came and deceived Duke Li, saying: 'In the Yan Ling battle, Xi Zhi summoned Chu, desired to make rebellion, and the inner son Zhou establish him.

sentences.zh: 會與國不具，是以事不成。」

translations.literal: Meeting with state not prepared, therefore matter not accomplished.'
translations.idiomatic: The meeting with the state was not prepared, therefore the matter was not accomplished.'

sentences.zh: 厲公告欒書。

translations.literal: Li Gong told Luan Shu.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Li told Luan Shu.

sentences.zh: 欒書曰：「其殆有矣！

translations.literal: Luan Shu said: 'It probably has it!
translations.idiomatic: Luan Shu said: 'It probably has it!

sentences.zh: 願公試使人之周微考之。」

translations.literal: Wish duke try send people to Zhou secretly examine it.'
translations.idiomatic: I wish the duke would try sending people to Zhou to secretly examine it.'

sentences.zh: 果使郤至於周。

translations.literal: Indeed they sent Xi Zhi to Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: Indeed they sent Xi Zhi to Zhou.

sentences.zh: 欒書又使公子周見郤至，郤至不知見賣也。

translations.literal: Luan Shu again sent Prince Zhou to meet Xi Zhi. Xi Zhi did not know he was being betrayed.
translations.idiomatic: Luan Shu again sent the prince Zhou to meet Xi Zhi. Xi Zhi did not know that he was being betrayed.

sentences.zh: 厲公驗之，信然，遂怨郤至，欲殺之。

translations.literal: Li Gong verified it and believed it truly. He then resented Xi Zhi and desired to kill him.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Li verified the matter and believed it to be true. He then resented Xi Zhi and desired to kill him.

sentences.zh: 八年，厲公獵，與姬飲，郤至殺豕奉進，宦者奪之。

translations.literal: In the eighth year, Li Gong went hunting and drank with his consort. Xi Zhi killed a pig and presented it. A eunuch seized it.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, Duke Li went hunting and drank with his consort. Xi Zhi killed a pig and presented it. A eunuch seized it.

sentences.zh: 郤至射殺宦者。

translations.literal: Xi Zhi shot and killed the eunuch.
translations.idiomatic: Xi Zhi shot and killed the eunuch.

sentences.zh: 公怒，曰：「季子欺予！」

translations.literal: Duke angered, said: 'Ji Zi deceives me!'
translations.idiomatic: The duke was angered and said: 'Ji Zi deceives me!'

sentences.zh: 將誅三郤，未發也。

translations.literal: He would execute the three Xi, but had not yet dispatched the order.
translations.idiomatic: He would execute the three Xi, but had not yet dispatched the order.

sentences.zh: 郤鉤欲攻公，曰：「我雖死，公亦病矣。」

translations.literal: Xi Gou desired attack duke, said: 'I though die, duke also ill.'
translations.idiomatic: Xi Gou desired to attack the duke and said: 'Though I die, the duke will also be harmed.'

sentences.zh: 郤至曰：「信不反君，智不害民，勇不作亂。

translations.literal: Xi Zhi said: 'Faithfulness not betray lord, wisdom not harm people, courage not make rebellion.
translations.idiomatic: Xi Zhi said: 'I am faithful and do not betray the lord, wise and do not harm the people, courageous and do not make rebellion.

sentences.zh: 失此三者，誰與我？

translations.literal: Lose these three, who with me?
translations.idiomatic: If I lose these three, who will be with me?

sentences.zh: 我死耳！」

translations.literal: I die only!'
translations.idiomatic: I will only die!'

sentences.zh: 十二月壬午，公令胥童以兵八百人襲攻殺三郤。

translations.literal: In the twelfth month on Ren Wu, the duke ordered Xu Tong with eight hundred troops to attack and kill the three Xi.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth month on Ren Wu, the duke ordered Xu Tong with eight hundred troops to attack and kill the three Xi.

sentences.zh: 胥童因以劫欒書、中行偃于朝，曰：「不殺二子，患必及公。」

translations.literal: Xu Tong then with kidnapped Luan Shu, Zhong Xing Yan at court, said: 'Not kill two sons, trouble must reach duke.'
translations.idiomatic: Xu Tong then kidnapped Luan Shu and Zhong Xing Yan at court and said: 'If we do not kill these two, trouble will certainly reach the duke.'

sentences.zh: 公曰：「一旦殺三卿，寡人不忍益也。」

translations.literal: Duke said: 'Suddenly kill three ministers, I not bear moreover.'
translations.idiomatic: The duke said: 'To suddenly kill three ministers—I cannot bear to do more.'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「人將忍君。」

translations.literal: Answered said: 'People will bear lord.'
translations.idiomatic: He answered and said: 'The people will bear with the lord.'

sentences.zh: 公弗聽，謝欒書等以誅郤氏罪：「大夫復位。」

translations.literal: Duke not listened, apologized Luan Shu etc. with executed Xi clan crime: 'Grandees resume position.'
translations.idiomatic: The duke did not listen, apologized to Luan Shu and the others for the crime of executing the Xi clan, and said: 'The grandees resume their positions.'

sentences.zh: 二子頓首曰：「幸甚幸甚！」

translations.literal: Two sons knocked heads said: 'Fortunate extremely fortunate extremely!'
translations.idiomatic: The two men knocked their heads and said: 'Most fortunate, most fortunate!'

sentences.zh: 公使胥童為卿。

translations.literal: The duke made Xu Tong a minister.
translations.idiomatic: The duke made Xu Tong a minister.

sentences.zh: 閏月乙卯，厲公游匠驪氏，欒書、中行偃以其黨襲捕厲公，囚之，殺胥童，而使人迎公子周于周而立之，是為悼公。

translations.literal: In the leap month on Yi Mao, Li Gong toured the Jiang Li clan. Luan Shu and Zhong Xing Yan with their faction attacked and captured Li Gong, imprisoned him, killed Xu Tong, and sent people to welcome Prince Zhou from Zhou and establish him. This was Dao Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the leap month on Yi Mao, Duke Li toured the Jiang Li clan. Luan Shu and Zhong Xing Yan with their faction attacked and captured Duke Li, imprisoned him, killed Xu Tong, and sent people to welcome Prince Zhou from Zhou and establish him. This was Duke Dao.

sentences.zh: 悼公元年正月庚申，欒書、中行偃弒厲公，葬之以一乘車。

translations.literal: In Dao Gong's first year, first month on Geng Shen, Luan Shu and Zhong Xing Yan assassinated Li Gong and buried him with one chariot.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Dao's first year, in the first month on Geng Shen, Luan Shu and Zhong Xing Yan assassinated Duke Li and buried him with one chariot.

sentences.zh: 厲公囚六日死，死十日庚午，智罃迎公子周來，至絳，刑雞與大夫盟而立之，是為悼公。

translations.literal: Li Gong was imprisoned for six days and died. Ten days after his death on Geng Wu, Zhi Ying welcomed Prince Zhou to come. They arrived at Jiang, cut a chicken to ally with the grandees, and established him. This was Dao Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Li was imprisoned for six days and died. Ten days after his death on Geng Wu, Zhi Ying welcomed Prince Zhou to come. They arrived at Jiang, cut a chicken to ally with the grandees, and established him. This was Duke Dao.

sentences.zh: 辛巳，朝武宮。

translations.literal: On Xin Si, held court at the Wu Palace.
translations.idiomatic: On Xin Si, he held court at the Wu Palace.

sentences.zh: 二月乙酉，即位。

translations.literal: In the second month on Yi You, he ascended the throne.
translations.idiomatic: In the second month on Yi You, he ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 悼公周者，其大父捷，晉襄公少子也，不得立，號為桓叔，桓叔最愛。

translations.literal: Dao Gong Zhou was such that his grandfather Jie was Jin Xiang Gong's youngest son. He was not able to be established and was styled Huan Shu. Huan Shu was most loved.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Dao Zhou was such that his grandfather Jie was Duke Xiang of Jin's youngest son. He was not able to be established and was styled Huan Shu. Huan Shu was the most loved.

sentences.zh: 桓叔生惠伯談，談生悼公周。

translations.literal: Huan Shu begot Hui Bo Tan, and Tan begot Dao Gong Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: Huan Shu begot Hui Bo Tan, and Tan begot Duke Dao Zhou.

sentences.zh: 周之立，年十四矣。

translations.literal: Zhou's establishment, age fourteen.
translations.idiomatic: When Zhou was established, he was fourteen years old.

sentences.zh: 悼公曰：「大父、父皆不得立而辟難於周，客死焉。

translations.literal: Dao Gong said: 'Grandfather, father all not able established and avoided difficulty at Zhou, died as guest there.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Dao said: 'My grandfather and father were both not able to be established and avoided the difficulty at Zhou, where they died as guests.

sentences.zh: 寡人自以疏遠，毋幾為君。

translations.literal: I myself consider myself distant and not nearly worthy to become lord.
translations.idiomatic: I myself consider myself distant and not nearly worthy to become lord.

sentences.zh: 今大夫不忘文、襄之意而惠立桓叔之後，賴宗廟大夫之靈，得奉晉祀，豈敢不戰戰乎？

translations.literal: Now grandees not forget Wen, Xiang intention and kindly establish Huan Shu successor, rely ancestral temple grandees spirit, obtain serve Jin sacrifices, how dare not tremble?
translations.idiomatic: Now the grandees have not forgotten the intention of Dukes Wen and Xiang and have kindly established Huan Shu's successor. Relying on the spirit of the ancestral temple and the grandees, I have obtained the ability to serve Jin's sacrifices. How dare I not tremble?

sentences.zh: 大夫其亦佐寡人！」

translations.literal: Grandees also assist me!'
translations.idiomatic: The grandees should also assist me!'

sentences.zh: 於是逐不臣者七人，修舊功，施德惠，收文公入時功臣後。

translations.literal: Thereupon he expelled seven people who were not subjects, repaired old merits, applied virtue and favor, and gathered the descendants of Wen Gong's entry time meritorious officials.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon he expelled seven people who were not subjects, repaired old merits, applied virtue and favor, and gathered the descendants of Duke Wen's entry time meritorious officials.

sentences.zh: 秋，伐鄭。

translations.literal: In autumn, attacked Zheng.
translations.idiomatic: In autumn, they attacked Zheng.

sentences.zh: 鄭師敗，遂至陳。

translations.literal: The Zheng army was defeated, and they then arrived at Chen.
translations.idiomatic: The Zheng army was defeated, and they then arrived at Chen.

sentences.zh: 三年，晉會諸侯。

translations.literal: In the third year, Jin met with the feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, Jin met with the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 悼公問群臣可用者，祁傒舉解狐。

translations.literal: Dao Gong asked the group of ministers for usable ones, and Qi Xi raised Xie Hu.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Dao asked the group of ministers for usable ones, and Qi Xi raised Xie Hu.

sentences.zh: 解狐，傒之仇。

translations.literal: Xie Hu, Xi's enemy.
translations.idiomatic: Xie Hu was Xi's enemy.

sentences.zh: 復問，舉其子祁午。

translations.literal: He asked again, and raised his son Qi Wu.
translations.idiomatic: He asked again, and raised his son Qi Wu.

sentences.zh: 君子曰：「祁傒可謂不黨矣！

translations.literal: Superior man said: 'Qi Xi can be called not partisan!
translations.idiomatic: The superior man said: 'Qi Xi can be called not partisan!

sentences.zh: 外舉不隱仇，內舉不隱子。」

translations.literal: Externally raise not conceal enemy, internally raise not conceal son.'
translations.idiomatic: Externally he raises without concealing his enemy, internally he raises without concealing his son.'

sentences.zh: 方會諸侯，悼公弟楊干亂行，魏絳戮其仆。

translations.literal: Just as they were meeting the feudal lords, Dao Gong's younger brother Yang Gan disrupted the procession. Wei Jiang executed his charioteer.
translations.idiomatic: Just as they were meeting the feudal lords, Duke Dao's younger brother Yang Gan disrupted the procession. Wei Jiang executed his charioteer.

sentences.zh: 悼公怒，或諫公，公卒賢絳，任之政，使和戎，戎大親附。

translations.literal: Dao Gong was angered. Some advised the duke, and the duke ultimately valued Jiang, entrusted him with governance, and made him pacify the Rong. The Rong greatly attached closely.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Dao was angered. Some advised the duke, and the duke ultimately valued Jiang, entrusted him with governance, and made him pacify the Rong. The Rong greatly attached closely.

sentences.zh: 十一年，悼公曰：「自吾用魏絳，九合諸侯，和戎、翟，魏子之力也。」

translations.literal: Eleventh year, Dao Gong said: 'Since I used Wei Jiang, nine times united feudal lords, pacified Rong, Di, Wei Zi's strength.'
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, Duke Dao said: 'Since I used Wei Jiang, I have nine times united the feudal lords and pacified the Rong and Di. This is Wei Zi's strength.'

sentences.zh: 賜之樂，三讓乃受之。

translations.literal: He granted him music. He declined three times before receiving it.
translations.idiomatic: He granted him music. He declined three times before receiving it.

sentences.zh: 冬，秦取我櫟。

translations.literal: In winter, Qin took our Li.
translations.idiomatic: In winter, Qin took our Li.

sentences.zh: 十四年，晉使六卿率諸侯伐秦，度涇，大敗秦軍，至棫林而去。

translations.literal: In the fourteenth year, Jin sent the six ministers to lead the feudal lords and attack Qin. They crossed the Jing, greatly defeated the Qin army, arrived at Yu Lin, and departed.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year, Jin sent the six ministers to lead the feudal lords and attack Qin. They crossed the Jing, greatly defeated the Qin army, arrived at Yu Lin, and departed.

sentences.zh: 十五年，悼公問治國於師曠。

translations.literal: In the fifteenth year, Dao Gong asked about governing the country from Shi Kuang.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, Duke Dao asked about governing the country from Shi Kuang.

sentences.zh: 師曠曰：「惟仁義為本。」

translations.literal: Shi Kuang said: 'Only benevolence righteousness as foundation.'
translations.idiomatic: Shi Kuang said: 'Only benevolence and righteousness should be the foundation.'

sentences.zh: 冬，悼公卒，子平公彪立。

translations.literal: In winter, Dao Gong died, and his son Ping Gong Biao was established.
translations.idiomatic: In winter, Duke Dao died, and his son Duke Ping Biao was established.

sentences.zh: 平公元年，伐齊，齊靈公與戰靡下，齊師敗走。

translations.literal: In Ping Gong's first year, attacked Qi. Qi Ling Gong battled at Mi Xia, and the Qi army was defeated and fled.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Ping's first year, they attacked Qi. Duke Ling of Qi battled at Mi Xia, and the Qi army was defeated and fled.

sentences.zh: 晏嬰曰：「君亦毋勇，何不止戰？」

translations.literal: Yan Ying said: 'Lord also not courageous, why not stop battle?'
translations.idiomatic: Yan Ying said: 'The lord is also not courageous. Why not stop the battle?'

sentences.zh: 遂去。

translations.literal: He then departed.
translations.idiomatic: He then departed.

sentences.zh: 晉追，遂圍臨菑，盡燒屠其郭中。

translations.literal: Jin pursued, then surrounded Lin Zi, and completely burned and massacred its outer city.
translations.idiomatic: Jin pursued, then surrounded Lin Zi, and completely burned and massacred its outer city.

sentences.zh: 東至膠，南至沂，齊皆城守，晉乃引兵歸。

translations.literal: East to Jiao, south to Yi, Qi all walled and defended. Jin then led the troops and returned.
translations.idiomatic: East to Jiao, south to Yi, Qi all walled and defended. Jin then led the troops and returned.

sentences.zh: 六年，魯襄公朝晉。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, Lu Xiang Gong attended court at Jin.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, Duke Xiang of Lu attended court at Jin.

sentences.zh: 晉欒逞有罪，奔齊。

translations.literal: Jin Luan Cheng had a crime and fled to Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Jin's Luan Cheng had a crime and fled to Qi.

sentences.zh: 八年，齊莊公微遣欒逞於曲沃，以兵隨之。

translations.literal: In the eighth year, Qi Zhuang Gong secretly sent Luan Cheng to Qu Wo, with troops following him.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, Duke Zhuang of Qi secretly sent Luan Cheng to Qu Wo, with troops following him.

sentences.zh: 齊兵上太行，欒逞從曲沃中反，襲入絳。

translations.literal: The Qi troops ascended Tai Hang. Luan Cheng rebelled from within Qu Wo and attacked, entering Jiang.
translations.idiomatic: The Qi troops ascended Tai Hang. Luan Cheng rebelled from within Qu Wo and attacked, entering Jiang.

sentences.zh: 絳不戒，平公欲自殺，范獻子止公，以其徒擊逞，逞敗走曲沃。

translations.literal: Jiang was not prepared. Ping Gong desired suicide. Fan Xian Zi stopped the duke and with his followers attacked Cheng. Cheng was defeated and fled to Qu Wo.
translations.idiomatic: Jiang was not prepared. Duke Ping desired suicide. Fan Xian Zi stopped the duke and with his followers attacked Cheng. Cheng was defeated and fled to Qu Wo.

sentences.zh: 曲沃攻逞，逞死，遂滅欒氏宗。

translations.literal: Qu Wo attacked Cheng. Cheng died, and they then extinguished the Luan clan lineage.
translations.idiomatic: Qu Wo attacked Cheng. Cheng died, and they then extinguished the Luan clan lineage.

sentences.zh: 逞者，欒書孫也。

translations.literal: Cheng was Luan Shu's grandson.
translations.idiomatic: Cheng was Luan Shu's grandson.

sentences.zh: 其入絳，與魏氏謀。

translations.literal: His entering Jiang was plotted with the Wei clan.
translations.idiomatic: His entering Jiang was plotted with the Wei clan.

sentences.zh: 齊莊公聞逞敗，乃還，取晉之朝歌去，以報臨菑之役也。

translations.literal: Qi Zhuang Gong heard Cheng defeated, then returned, took Jin's Zhao Ge departed, to repay Lin Zi campaign.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhuang of Qi heard that Cheng was defeated, then returned, took Jin's Zhao Ge and departed, to repay the Lin Zi campaign.

sentences.zh: 十年，齊崔杼弒其君莊公。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, Qi Cui Zhu assassinated his lord Zhuang Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, Qi's Cui Zhu assassinated his lord Duke Zhuang.

sentences.zh: 晉因齊亂，伐敗齊於高唐去，報太行之役也。

translations.literal: Jin, because of Qi's disorder, attacked and defeated Qi at Gao Tang and departed, repaying the Tai Hang campaign.
translations.idiomatic: Jin, because of Qi's disorder, attacked and defeated Qi at Gao Tang and departed, repaying the Tai Hang campaign.

sentences.zh: 十四年，吳延陵季子來使，與趙文子、韓宣子、魏獻子語，曰：「晉國之政，卒歸此三家矣。」

translations.literal: Fourteenth year, Wu Yan Ling Ji Zi came envoy, with Zhao Wen Zi, Han Xuan Zi, Wei Xian Zi spoke, said: 'Jin country's governance, ultimately belongs these three houses.'
translations.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year, Wu's Yan Ling Ji Zi came as an envoy and spoke with Zhao Wen Zi, Han Xuan Zi, and Wei Xian Zi. He said: 'Jin's governance will ultimately belong to these three houses.'

sentences.zh: 十九年，齊使晏嬰如晉，與叔向語。

translations.literal: In the nineteenth year, Qi sent Yan Ying to Jin, and he spoke with Shu Xiang.
translations.idiomatic: In the nineteenth year, Qi sent Yan Ying to Jin, and he spoke with Shu Xiang.

sentences.zh: 叔向曰：「晉，季世也。

translations.literal: Shu Xiang said: 'Jin, final generation.
translations.idiomatic: Shu Xiang said: 'Jin is in its final generation.

sentences.zh: 公厚賦為臺池而不恤政，政在私門，其可久乎！」

translations.literal: Duke heavy taxes for towers ponds but not cares governance, governance in private gates, how can long endure!'
translations.idiomatic: The duke heavily taxes for towers and ponds but does not care for governance. Governance is in private gates. How can it long endure!'

sentences.zh: 晏子然之。

translations.literal: Yan Zi assented to it.
translations.idiomatic: Yan Zi assented to it.

sentences.zh: 二十二年，伐燕。

translations.literal: In the twenty-second year, attacked Yan.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-second year, they attacked Yan.

sentences.zh: 二十六年，平公卒，子昭公夷立。

translations.literal: In the twenty-sixth year, Ping Gong died, and his son Zhao Gong Yi was established.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-sixth year, Duke Ping died, and his son Duke Zhao Yi was established.

sentences.zh: 昭公六年卒。

translations.literal: Zhao Gong died in the sixth year.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhao died in the sixth year.

sentences.zh: 六卿彊，公室卑。

translations.literal: The six ministers were strong, the ducal chamber was low.
translations.idiomatic: The six ministers were strong, and the ducal chamber was low.

sentences.zh: 子頃公去疾立。

translations.literal: His son Qing Gong Qu Ji was established.
translations.idiomatic: His son Duke Qing Qu Ji was established.

sentences.zh: 頃公六年，周景王崩，王子爭立。

translations.literal: In Qing Gong's sixth year, Zhou Jing Wang died, and the wang's sons contended for establishment.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Qing's sixth year, King Jing of Zhou died, and the king's sons contended for establishment.

sentences.zh: 晉六卿平王室亂，立敬王。

translations.literal: The Jin six ministers pacified the wang chamber's disorder and established Jing Wang.
translations.idiomatic: The Jin six ministers pacified the royal chamber's disorder and established King Jing.

sentences.zh: 九年，魯季氏逐其君昭公，昭公居乾侯。

translations.literal: In the ninth year, the Lu Ji clan expelled their lord Zhao Gong, and Zhao Gong resided at Qian Hou.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, the Lu Ji clan expelled their lord Duke Zhao, and Duke Zhao resided at Qian Hou.

sentences.zh: 十一年，衛、宋使使請晉納魯君。

translations.literal: In the eleventh year, Wei and Song sent envoys requesting that Jin accept the Lu lord.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, Wei and Song sent envoys requesting that Jin accept the Lu lord.

sentences.zh: 季平子私賂范獻子，獻子受之，乃謂晉君曰：「季氏無罪。」

translations.literal: Ji Ping Zi privately bribed Fan Xian Zi, Xian Zi received it, then told Jin lord said: 'Ji clan no crime.'
translations.idiomatic: Ji Ping Zi privately bribed Fan Xian Zi. Xian Zi received it, then told the Jin lord and said: 'The Ji clan has no crime.'

sentences.zh: 不果入魯君。

translations.literal: They did not ultimately accept the Lu lord.
translations.idiomatic: They did not ultimately accept the Lu lord.

sentences.zh: 十二年，晉之宗家祁傒孫，叔向子，相惡於君。

translations.literal: Twelfth year, Jin's ancestral house Qi Xi grandson, Shu Xiang son, mutually disliked by lord.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, Jin's ancestral house Qi Xi's grandson and Shu Xiang's son were mutually disliked by the lord.

sentences.zh: 六卿欲弱公室，乃遂以法盡滅其族。

translations.literal: The six ministers desired to weaken the ducal chamber, so they accordingly used the law to completely extinguish their clan.
translations.idiomatic: The six ministers desired to weaken the ducal chamber, so they accordingly used the law to completely extinguish their clan.

sentences.zh: 而分其邑為十縣，各令其子為大夫。

translations.literal: And they divided their cities into ten counties, each ordering their son to be a grandee.
translations.idiomatic: And they divided their cities into ten counties, each ordering their son to be a grandee.

sentences.zh: 晉益弱，六卿皆大。

translations.literal: Jin became increasingly weak, while the six ministers all became great.
translations.idiomatic: Jin became increasingly weak, while the six ministers all became great.

sentences.zh: 十四年，頃公卒，子定公午立。

translations.literal: In the fourteenth year, Qing Gong died, and his son Ding Gong Wu was established.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year, Duke Qing died, and his son Duke Ding Wu was established.

sentences.zh: 定公十一年，魯陽虎奔晉，趙鞅簡子捨之。

translations.literal: In Ding Gong's eleventh year, Lu Yang Hu fled to Jin, and Zhao Yang Jian Zi sheltered him.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Ding's eleventh year, the Lu man Yang Hu fled to Jin, and Zhao Yang Jian Zi gave him shelter.

sentences.zh: 十二年，孔子相魯。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, Kong Qiu became prime minister of Lu.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, Kong Qiu became prime minister of Lu.

sentences.zh: 十五年，趙鞅使邯鄲大夫午，不信，欲殺午，午與中行寅、范吉射親攻趙鞅，鞅走保晉陽。

translations.literal: In the fifteenth year, Zhao Yang sent the Han Dan grandee Wu, but he was not trusted and desired to kill Wu. Wu, with Zhong Xing Yin and Fan Ji She, personally attacked Zhao Yang. Yang fled and defended Jin Yang.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, Zhao Yang sent the Han Dan grandee Wu, but he was not trusted and desired to kill Wu. Wu, with Zhong Xing Yin and Fan Ji She, personally attacked Zhao Yang. Yang fled and defended Jin Yang.

sentences.zh: 定公圍晉陽。

translations.literal: Ding Gong surrounded Jin Yang.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ding surrounded Jin Yang.

sentences.zh: 荀櫟、韓不信、魏侈與范、中行為仇，乃移兵伐范、中行。

translations.literal: Xun Yue, Han Bu Xin, and Wei Chi were enemies with Fan and Zhong Xing, so they shifted troops to attack Fan and Zhong Xing.
translations.idiomatic: Xun Yue, Han Bu Xin, and Wei Chi were enemies with Fan and Zhong Xing, so they shifted the troops to attack Fan and Zhong Xing.

sentences.zh: 范、中行反，晉君擊之，敗范、中行。

translations.literal: Fan and Zhong Xing rebelled. The Jin lord attacked them and defeated Fan and Zhong Xing.
translations.idiomatic: Fan and Zhong Xing rebelled. The Jin lord attacked them and defeated Fan and Zhong Xing.

sentences.zh: 范、中行走朝歌，保之。

translations.literal: Fan and Zhong Xing fled to Zhao Ge and defended it.
translations.idiomatic: Fan and Zhong Xing fled to Zhao Ge and defended it.

sentences.zh: 韓、魏為趙鞅謝晉君，乃赦趙鞅，復位。

translations.literal: Han and Wei apologized to the Jin lord for Zhao Yang, and he was then pardoned and restored to his position.
translations.idiomatic: Han and Wei apologized to the Jin lord for Zhao Yang, and he was then pardoned and restored to his position.

sentences.zh: 二十二年，晉敗范、中行氏，二子奔齊。

translations.literal: In the twenty-second year, Jin defeated the Fan and Zhong Xing clans, and the two sons fled to Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-second year, Jin defeated the Fan and Zhong Xing clans, and the two sons fled to Qi.

sentences.zh: 三十年，定公與吳王夫差會黃池，爭長，趙鞅時從，卒長吳。

translations.literal: In the thirtieth year, Ding Gong met with Wu Wang Fu Chai at Huang Chi and contended for seniority. Zhao Yang followed at the time, and ultimately Wu was senior.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirtieth year, Duke Ding met with King Fu Chai of Wu at Huang Chi and contended for seniority. Zhao Yang followed at the time, and ultimately Wu was senior.

sentences.zh: 三十一年，齊田常弒其君簡公，而立簡公弟驁為平公。

translations.literal: In the thirty-first year, Qi Tian Chang assassinated his lord Jian Gong, and established Jian Gong's younger brother Ao as Ping Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-first year, Qi's Tian Chang assassinated his lord Duke Jian, and established Duke Jian's younger brother Ao as Duke Ping.

sentences.zh: 三十三年，孔子卒。

translations.literal: In the thirty-third year, Kong Qiu died.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-third year, Kong Qiu died.

sentences.zh: 三十七年，定公卒，子出公鑿立。

translations.literal: In the thirty-seventh year, Ding Gong died, and his son Chu Gong Zao was established.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-seventh year, Duke Ding died, and his son Duke Chu Zao was established.

sentences.zh: 出公十七年，知伯與趙、韓、魏共分范、中行地以為邑。

translations.literal: In Chu Gong's seventeenth year, Zhi Bo with Zhao, Han, and Wei together divided the Fan and Zhong Xing lands as their cities.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Chu's seventeenth year, Zhi Bo with Zhao, Han, and Wei together divided the Fan and Zhong Xing lands as their cities.

sentences.zh: 出公怒，告齊、魯，欲以伐四卿。

translations.literal: Chu Gong was angered and told Qi and Lu, desiring to attack the four ministers with them.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Chu was angered and told Qi and Lu, desiring to attack the four ministers with them.

sentences.zh: 四卿恐，遂反攻出公。

translations.literal: The four ministers feared, so they then counterattacked Chu Gong.
translations.idiomatic: The four ministers feared, so they then counterattacked Duke Chu.

sentences.zh: 出公奔齊，道死。

translations.literal: Chu Gong fled to Qi and died on the road.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Chu fled to Qi and died on the road.

sentences.zh: 故知伯乃立昭公曾孫驕為晉君，是為哀公。

translations.literal: Therefore Zhi Bo then established Zhao Gong's great-grandson Jiao as Jin lord. This was Ai Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore Zhi Bo then established Duke Zhao's great-grandson Jiao as the Jin lord. This was Duke Ai.

sentences.zh: 哀公大父雍，晉昭公少子也，號為戴子。

translations.literal: Ai Gong's grandfather Yong was Jin Zhao Gong's youngest son and was styled Dai Zi.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ai's grandfather Yong was the youngest son of Duke Zhao of Jin and was styled Dai Zi.

sentences.zh: 戴子生忌。

translations.literal: Dai Zi begot Ji.
translations.idiomatic: Dai Zi begot Ji.

sentences.zh: 忌善知伯，蚤死，故知伯欲盡并晉，未敢，乃立忌子驕為君。

translations.literal: Ji was good to Zhi Bo but died early. Therefore Zhi Bo desired to completely annex Jin but did not dare, so he established Ji's son Jiao as lord.
translations.idiomatic: Ji was good to Zhi Bo but died early. Therefore Zhi Bo desired to completely annex Jin but did not dare, so he established Ji's son Jiao as the lord.

sentences.zh: 當是時，晉國政皆決知伯，晉哀公不得有所制。

translations.literal: At this time, Jin country's governance all decided Zhi Bo, Jin Ai Gong could not have any control.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, all of the governance of Jin was decided by Zhi Bo, and Duke Ai of Jin could not exercise any control over it.

sentences.zh: 知伯遂有范、中行地，最彊。

translations.literal: Zhi Bo then possessed the Fan and Zhong Xing lands and was the strongest.
translations.idiomatic: Zhi Bo then possessed the Fan and Zhong Xing lands and was the strongest.

sentences.zh: 哀公四年，趙襄子、韓康子、魏桓子共殺知伯，盡并其地。

translations.literal: In Ai Gong's fourth year, Zhao Xiang Zi, Han Kang Zi, and Wei Huan Zi together killed Zhi Bo and completely annexed his lands.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Ai's fourth year, Zhao Xiang Zi, Han Kang Zi, and Wei Huan Zi together killed Zhi Bo and completely annexed all of the lands.

sentences.zh: 十八年，哀公卒，子幽公柳立。

translations.literal: In the eighteenth year, Ai Gong died, and his son You Gong Liu was established.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, Duke Ai died, and his son Duke You Liu was established.

sentences.zh: 幽公之時，晉畏，反朝韓、趙、魏之君。

translations.literal: You Gong's time, Jin feared, instead attended court Han, Zhao, Wei lords.
translations.idiomatic: During Duke You's time, Jin feared and instead attended court to the lords of Han, Zhao, and Wei.

sentences.zh: 獨有絳、曲沃，餘皆入三晉。

translations.literal: They only possessed Jiang and Qu Wo. The remainder all entered the three Jin.
translations.idiomatic: They only possessed Jiang and Qu Wo. The remainder all entered the three Jin.

sentences.zh: 十五年，魏文侯初立。

translations.literal: In the fifteenth year, Wei Wen Hou was first established.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, Wei Wen Hou was first established.

sentences.zh: 十八年，幽公淫婦人，夜竊出邑中，盜殺幽公。

translations.literal: In the eighteenth year, You Gong was licentious with women. At night he secretly left the city, and a thief killed You Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, Duke You was licentious with women. At night he secretly left the city, and a thief killed Duke You.

sentences.zh: 魏文侯以兵誅晉亂，立幽公子止，是為烈公。

translations.literal: Wei Wen Hou with troops executed Jin's disorder and established You Gong's son Zhi. This was Lie Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Wen Hou with troops executed Jin's disorder and established Duke You's son Zhi as the lord. This was Duke Lie.

sentences.zh: 烈公十九年，周威烈王賜趙、韓、魏皆命為諸侯。

translations.literal: In Lie Gong's nineteenth year, Zhou Wei Lie Wang granted Zhao, Han, and Wei all to be appointed as feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Lie's nineteenth year, King Wei Lie of Zhou granted Zhao, Han, and Wei all to be appointed as the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 二十七年，烈公卒，子孝公頎立。

translations.literal: In the twenty-seventh year, Lie Gong died, and his son Xiao Gong Si was established.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-seventh year, Duke Lie died, and his son Duke Xiao Si was established.

sentences.zh: 孝公九年，魏武侯初立，襲邯鄲，不勝而去。

translations.literal: In Xiao Gong's ninth year, Wei Wu Hou was first established. He attacked Han Dan but was not victorious and departed.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xiao's ninth year, Wei Wu Hou was first established. He attacked the city of Han Dan but was not victorious and then departed.

sentences.zh: 十七年，孝公卒，子靜公俱酒立。

translations.literal: In the seventeenth year, Xiao Gong died, and his son Jing Gong Ju Jiu was established.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventeenth year, Duke Xiao died, and his son Duke Jing Ju Jiu was established.

sentences.zh: 是歲，齊威王元年也。

translations.literal: This year was Qi Wei Wang's first year.
translations.idiomatic: This year was King Wei of Qi's first year.

sentences.zh: 靜公二年，魏武侯、韓哀侯、趙敬侯滅晉後而三分其地。

translations.literal: In Jing Gong's second year, Wei Wu Hou, Han Ai Hou, and Zhao Jing Hou extinguished Jin's remnant and three-way divided its lands.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Jing's second year, Wei Wu Hou, Han Ai Hou, and Zhao Jing Hou extinguished Jin's remnant and three-way divided the lands.

sentences.zh: 靜公遷為家人，晉絕不祀。

translations.literal: Jing Gong was moved to become a commoner. Jin was absolutely not sacrificed to.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jing was moved to become a commoner. Jin was absolutely not sacrificed to.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：晉文公，古所謂明君也，亡居外十九年，至困約，及即位而行賞，尚忘介子推，況驕主乎？

translations.literal: Grand historian said: Jin Wen Gong, ancient called enlightened lord, fled resided outside nineteen years, extremely distressed constrained, when ascended throne performed rewards, still forgot Jie Zi Tui, moreover arrogant lords?
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian said: Duke Wen of Jin was what the ancients called an enlightened lord. He fled and resided outside for nineteen years, in extreme distress and constraint. When he ascended the throne and performed rewards, he still forgot Jie Zi Tui. How much more so would arrogant lords?

sentences.zh: 靈公既弒，其後成、景致嚴，至厲大刻，大夫懼誅，禍作。

translations.literal: Ling Gong was already assassinated. His descendants Cheng and Jing brought severity. To Li was greatly harsh. The grandees feared execution, and calamity arose.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ling was already assassinated. His descendants Cheng and Jing brought severity. To Li was greatly harsh. The grandees feared execution, and calamity arose.

sentences.zh: 悼公以後日衰，六卿專權。

translations.literal: After Dao Gong, it daily declined, and the six ministers monopolized power.
translations.idiomatic: After Duke Dao, it daily declined, and the six ministers monopolized power.

sentences.zh: 故君道之御其臣下。

translations.literal: Therefore lord way's controlling their ministers below.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore the way of the lord in controlling his ministers below.

sentences.zh: 固不易哉！

translations.literal: Indeed not easy!
translations.idiomatic: Indeed it is not easy!
